text: 15/20 reminds me of the founders dirty bastard, not quite as chocolatey, but an ale thats a good mix of malt, bitterness and chocolate. Very good

Poured from a bottle. Cloudy reddish-brown with a creamy tan head that leaves a fine lacing on the glass. Aroma is malty caramel. A light sweetness quickly followed by hoppy bitter with moderately long finish. Medium body and a little thick and creamy on the palate.

Bottle from Beers of Europe, drunk in the comfort of my own dwelling. Its a deep brownish amber, clear with a magnificent off-white head. Lovely aroma: cherries, a touch of cinnamon, some glorious resinous esters. Sweet taste at first but the hoppy bitterness creates a barrier of dryness. Chocolate berry notes with an almost patchouli note in the aftertaste. Carbonation is extremely high. A magnificent creation.

Piana obfita, średnio trwała. Barwa herbaciano brązowa, klarowna. W aromacie karmel, orzechy, masło, herbata i dojrzałe owoce tropikalne. W smaku dokładnie to samo, półsłodkie, z ziołowym finiszem. Goryczka średnia, tytoniowo przyprawowa. Średnie wysycenie, lekko pikantne i mdłe w odbiorze.

Średnie piwo, nie wiem skąd tyle nagród i wysokich ocen. Ewidentnie jest tu diacetyl, z tym tylko, że to chyba zamierzone (coś jak czeskie pilsy?). Niemniej mi to nie odpowiada i na pewno nie poprawia pijalności.

12oz bottle from eden prairie liquor with commonmac during March madness. Murky red brown with off white head. Sugar and hop nose. Thicker sticky body. Resin hop, malt, rich, some bubble gum, and very slight biscuit cracker. Some grapefruit as well. Very bitter, but in a good way. Definitely a better way to do a red ale. Dont have to be a rocket scientist to know this is a good beer.

Bottle acquired at Eden Prairie Liquors and consumed during Day 2 of March Madness with commonshawn. Assertive hop aroma from the onset with resin, grapefruit, and other citrus notes. Attractive darker amber color with a light tan head (roughly a quarter finger). Taste is an interesting combination of seemingly multiple styles. There is an overarching bitter hop note presence but malty, caramel, toffee qualities act as much more than supporting actors as the sip progresses. Almost a background bourbon barrel characteristic that probably goes along with the alcohol bite coming through. Citrus rind bitterness and pine resin sticks around and dominates the aftertaste. Hard to classify this one as an amber ale...much more like a red IPA. I dont like space but I like this rocket fueled effort.

33,5 cl bottle. Big off-white head on an opaque dark red beer. Aromas of malts, cookie and caramel contrasting with citrus and some slight menthol. Taste more or less follows, some grapefuit as well. Dont remember the menthol from earlier, brings down the taste a bit. Nice bitterness on the palate in the finish, fairly smooth for medium body and carbonation, maybe a little overcarbonated. Still longing for slightly less hoppiness, and just a bit more malt character, but nevertheless one of the best red/amber ales Ive had.

0.355l bottle. Hazy dark orange body with a thick beige head. Aroma of caramel, grapefruit, pine, rose hips and toast. Taste of toast, caramel, grapefruit and pine. Light medium bodied with average carbonation. The grapefruit-like bitterbess stays for a long time after the sip. Very nice beer.
Exactly the kind of red that I love. Plenty of hoppy freshness - citrus, grapefruit and some pine - against a sweet caramel and biscuit malt. Goes down very easily. Could be dangerous.
(Bottle) Foggy brown-red body with big tan head. Aroma of roasted caramel malt and dark fruit; cherry, prune. Medium body. Alcohol is up front; malty caramel, some pine; a little smoke.
An all-around solid performer. Good colour, flavour, hop character, and balance.

Bottle at The Bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a slightly hazy amber colour with a frothy beige head.
Aroma of caramel, toast, pine, some red berries, slight orange and subtle spicy hops. Taste of caramel, toast, resin, red berries, some jammy fruits, slight orange, a little grapefruit and subtle spicy hops. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A dry, fruity, resinous hop bitterness in the finish. A really flavourful amber ale, perfectly balanced. Lots of caramel and fruit with great citrus, spice and resinous hoppiness. Very nice.
strong malty aroma. dark red in color with nice long lasting head. taste is hop forward with piney/resinous notes. underlying maltyness with notes of medium caramel malts, raisin.

Aroma is "red" malty and dusty with a sweet lingering sensation. Taste is dark toffee with a light brown sugar touch. Red berries and murky hay. There is something in here that does not appeal to me at all and totally destroys the experience. Is it licorice? Cant come to terms with this one.

Malty, caramel, resin, light raisins, alcohol.
Ruby colour, big beige head, good amount of lacing. 
Big bite, noticable sweetness, lightly salty, caramel and resin. 
Medium body, sticky feel, average carbonation, sweet and bitter finish.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown colour with a fluffy white head, aroma is light and hoppy, the taste is medium bitterness with a dry bitter fruit finish.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, orange, pine, hops, citrus and grapefruit.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque dark orange/dark brown beer with heavy yeast and with a slight/medium off-white/beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, orange and pine; ends slightly bitter and dry with hops, citrus and grapefruit.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. What a great, thick and creamy head. The aroma could have been stronger thanks to this. Lovely soft caramel/hop flavour too. Great beer for its style.

Intense pine, caramel, marmalade, bitter citrus fruits. Hazy amber, medium, off-white, creamy head. Medium sweet and light bitter. More piney hops, bitter orange, dark malts, soft carnation, medium bodied, long-duration, quite bitter and dry finish. Super intense and powerful Amber Ale, great flavours and complexity. Bottle at Sea Containers, Southwark.

Explosión de sabor, un cervezón en toda regla que combina perfectamente sabores malteados, herbales y sobre todo lupulados, una cerveza para cerveceros y para sentarte y olvidarte de los problemas que hay en el mundo, muy muy top

La Red Rocket versa nel bicchiere di colore mogano, quasi marrone, con riflessi rosso rubino e risultando molto limpida; spessa schiuma, densa e cremosa, bianca, di buona persistenza e allacciatura. Aroma iniziale dominato dal luppolo, pino e note agrumate (pompelmo); percezione anche di malto, che però rimane in secondo piano rispetto alla supremazia luppolata. In bocca si viene frontalmente attaccati dal luppolo, subito percezione di amaro, di resina e di secchezza. Solo successivamente con lo scaldarsi della birra, fa la sua comparsa il malto caramellato, ed altri notevoli sapori: pompelmo, mandarino, ananas, pesca, mango, limone / buccia darancia, pino, caramello, zucchero di canna, biscotto. Fantastica complessità e buon equilibrio, decisa carbonazione, corpo pieno; una leggera astringenza ed una moderata amarezza, alcool ben nascosto percepito solo nel finale.

[ ASPECTO ]
 La Red Rocket Ale presenta turbidez por frío que desaparece al alcanzar temperatura de servicio. Se muestra entonces brillante y límpida, lo que permite apreciar su precioso color ambar-cobre. La espuma tintada en color vainilla es muy cremosa, de abundancia media y bastante persistente, y presenta una buena adherencia y notable carbonatación.

 [ EN NARIZ ]
 Notas de Cata Red Rocket AleDe intensidad media y complejidad media-alta, las primeras notas en nariz son tostadas de caramelo, crema quemada y pan ligeramente tostado. A continuación y enseguida vienen las herbales y especiadas del lúpulo, con algo de pimienta y el picor de la hierba recién cortada, así como un punto azufrado con quizá algo de col de bruselas. Las notas predominantes vienen de los especiados y tostados.

 [ EN BOCA ]
 En cuanto a los cuatro gustos básicos (dulce, salado, ácido y amargo; dejamos de momento de lado el umami y otros), presenta un amargor marcado que parece provenir tanto del tostado como del lúpulo, dando como resultado un amargor sabroso y muy agradable. Buen equilibrio con el ligero dulzor de caramelo tostado, pero manteniendo la predominancia del amargor.

 Respecto a la sensación en boca, es de cuerpo ligero-medio, textura ligeramente chispeante y de un refrescante muy agradable. En boca se crece y el amargor lo domina todo sin sofocar las diversas notas. El caramelo quemado está siempre presente y las notas herbales aparecen después de un rato en boca. Con 6,8% ABV, la sensación alcohólica es baja a moderada.

 La persistencia es bastante buena, media-alta y el amargor no resulta astringente, por lo que se hace agradable todo el tiempo. Tras cerca de un minuto, es el caramelo quemado el que se apodera de tu lengua y paladar, casi como si estuvieras chupeteando una cuchara con la que hubieras preparado caramelo en la sartén, aunque mucho menos dulce.

 [ CONSIDERACIONES GENERALES Y MARIDAJE ]
 De trago medio y una muy considerable bebestibilidad, la Red Rocket Ale es perfecta para tragos largos si tienes sed. No sólo te hidratará, sino que te dejará una fantástica sensación en boca.

 Su amargor marcado pero no avasallador la hace perfecta para aperitivos de intensidad media, y para carnes ligeras y medias, como pollo especiado, cerdo o ternera. Adecuada también para ensaladas sabrosas.

 [ OPINIÓN PERSONAL ]
 Esta amber ale es una cerveza arquetípica de la escuela cervecera americana, muy sabrosa y equilibrada, que se bebe fácil y con gran placer. Merece cada uno de los 100 puntos RateBeer por estilo que ha recibido (y 97 en el cómputo general). Si tiene oportunidad, disfrútela.

This is a very big Amber and I think that explains its rating at the top of the style. Caramel malts upfront and pine, herbal hops at the back. Certainly reminds me more of a strong ale, maybe a Coopers Vintage. Very tasty.

12 oz bottle at Uplands. Reddish copper color with off white head. Aroma is malty, burnt sugar, dark caramel, pine, grass and slight earthy herby notes. Taste is nicely balanced, herbs, piney hops, burnt sugar, dark caramel and bready malt leading to a malty finish. Nice, really nice!

(8-15-16) Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a snifter glass. Mahogany color highlighted by a burnt orange hue. Sustainable, creamy off-white head. Sweet caramel and roasted malts on the nose. In tasting it there is a sweet and smooth caramel maltiness up front that immediately lends toward an explosion of pine hoppiness leaving the palate dry.

Pours a dark amber with a foamy white head. Aroma is caramel, with herbal, spicy, and rye hops. Flavor is similar, with more focus on the hops and less on the malts. Has a sneaky sort of carbonation, in that it takes my tongue a minute to notice it, with a light body. Good stuff.
330ml bottle. Pours a medium red with off white head. Mild rye and malt nose. An almost sweet taste with thr malt coming through again.
Awesome beer. Looks like an Arrogant Bastard but darker, first taste is creamy, malty. Foam keeps caramel color and diminishes by the end. Will make it a regular.

Pours a dirty, hazy brown, rescued by a nice beige head leaving great lacing. Aroma is really good - dark fruits underneath an earthy, grainy caramel and brown sugar base. Taste is a mix of pine and earthy herbal rye, all mellowing quickly into a lightly toasted bready malt finish. This is much better out of the bottle. Well done.
Had a sample at WOBFest 2016. Decent amber ale with a solid caramel flavor and pretty heavy carbonation.

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, best before 10/28/2016. Pours slightly hazy dark ruby red color with a 2 finger dense and rocky light khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Dense soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, mango, lemon/orange peel, light pine, caramel, brown sugar, toasted biscuit, light nuttiness, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of juicy citrus/tropical hops and dark/bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, mango, lemon/orange peel, pine, caramel, brown sugar, toasted biscuit, light nuttiness, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Moderate pine/citrus peel/grassy bitterness; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, mango, lemon/orange peel, pine, caramel, brown sugar, toasted biscuit, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and dark/bready malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and minimal hop astringency after the finish. Light-moderate dryness from bitterness, that increases through the glass. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth moderately sticky/creamy/bready balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an outstanding hoppy red ale. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and dark/bready malt flavors; very smooth and easy to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.

On tap at St. Augustines. Slightly hazy amber, strong tan head. 
Aroma is sweet, caramel, hops, dark fruits. Taste is sweet, tropical fruits bitterness, caramel. Piney bitterness aftertaste. Very good.

Pours cloudy mahogany with low off-white head. Aroma of pine, grapefruit, light caramel and butterscotch. Taste is initial sweet followed by a butterscotch sweet and blood orange bitter finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.

On tap, 16 oz. pour. Pours a muddy reddish brown with a thin ecru head. Malty aroma with a faint hint of peat. Malty, sweet flavor. Some hops, just enough to keep the sweetness in check. Medium to full body. Nice.

Nice hazy, reddish brown, generous head and visibly lively carbonation. Sweet dates, toasted caramel, citrus, licorice on nose. Black licorice, sharp citrus, toasted malts in flavor profile. Carbonation lends more creaminess than effervescence. Long drying, bitter finish.

Tap / Tirador.
@ 7 Days Brew, Nagoya, Japon.
A: Reddish brown / Marron rojizo.
T/S: Malt, sweet, hops, citrusy / Malta, dulce, lupulo, citrico.
Dulce Botella 33 cl tomada en el momento en. El kraken 01..04..2016. Lote BRRRA1 Zombier Fcpref 05..2016. Red Ale con sabor y buen amargo final. Buena.
Very tasty, from bottle. Nice deep flavours, caramel and malt. Full bodied, good carbonation.
Bottle @ The Queens Head, Stockholm. Well balanced but a bit too hoppy for my taste.

Reddish/brown color with an off-white head, good lasting and nice lacework. Aroma hoppy with resin notes, slightly toasty. Flavor has a decent bitterness, slightly citrus, some toasty and some caramelish hints. Good bitterness in the final with good duration.

Originally rated on 5/21/08. Another good beer from B.R. it poured a dark reddish brown with an incredibly thick, lasting tan head, good lacing. Aroma and tastes of citrus and hops, sweet malts, and caramel. slightly dry, alcohol was noticeable but not overwhelming. Good solid brew

Botella. Presencia rojiza con corona blanca persistente, carbonatacion media. Aroma a cereal y bollos con notas de pino y resina. En boca interesante mezcla dulce/ amargo bastante sedosa y cuerpo consitente. Final seco y con bastante dulzor

Tomada en el Kraken.

Red Ale, muy aromática.
Con toques dulces, muy fácil de beber.
Deja un retrogusto muy seco en el paladar y amargo.

Más compleja declo q parece a primer trago.

Color rojizo, espuma blanca.
Cerveza de calidad, para repetir.

Una versión bastante macarra de las rojas escocesas. Mucho cuerpo y un toque lupulado extra que contrasta con un final del trago dulce y maltoso y un retrogusto que nos lleva de nuevo al amargor del lúpulo americano.

Botella @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 24-02-2016.
BBD: 05-2016. Batch: BRRA1.
Color ámbar, sabor caramelo, frutal, cuerpo medio

Aroma a caramelo tostado pero también un poco a lúpulo
Buen color y aspecto
Sabor a caramelo aúnque muy sutil para mi gusto

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 fl oz bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 24-02-2016.
BBD: 05-2016. Batch: BRRA1.
In short: little harsh amber roasty ale.
Pours hazy amber with nice off white head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Roasty, licorice, plums, caramel nose. medium body, soft to average carbonation, little crispy texture. Taste is some harsh due to roasted malts, licorice, malty, bready, ripe fruit caramel, toffee. Ends a bit dry.
Bottle from Biercab Shop. Copper colour with white head. Grain, caramel, pine aroma. Sweet, grain, caramel, pine, resinous, citric taste. Medium body.
Pours a slightly hazy reddish brown from a bottle with a thick egg nog colored head, leaving good lacing. Big caramel/toffee flavor, lots of bitterness but not overly so. Good beer.

Draft at the brewpub. Pours clear copper with a creamy off-white head. The nose has some toasted pine, grainy bread. Medium sweet flavorbwith toasted grains, earth, some line cleaner, pine, orange rind. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Lightly resinous to finish, some more pine, earth, old citys, grainy bread. So so.

Sample on tap at the brewpub. Clear deep red pour with thin lacy white head. Aroma is really malty, super red, light piney resinous aromas. Taste is bitter, toasted grain, very resinous. Palate is med bodied with good carbonation. Decent.

Draught at Bear Republic. Almost clear copper liquid with small to medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, toast, toffee and bread. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of citrus, red berries and toast. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice.

Pours a copper-golden with a short, light tan head. Grapefruit nose with a faint accent of umami. Full mouthfeel with a light, fine burn. Heavy on the toasted malt. Toffee and grapefruit flavor. Gets a little hop hot at the finish.
Bottle shared from AA. Big malty, caramel flavors stand out but nice piney, juicy hops match well. I was pretty lit by this point, but I remember the heavy body. Solid.
Tap at matchbox, palm springs. Dark reddish brown color, white head. Aroma has lots of malts and hops. Malty, some roasty notes, caramel, big hoppy end.
Bottle in LA. Hoppy amber ale. Not sure where that bastardised scotch ale is. Decent amber ale.

Clear dark amber pour, thin tan head. Malt and hops in a tug of war for the nose. Bittersweet. Middle is big roasted malt footprint, sweet caramel notes, toffee lurking at the edges. Finish leans sweet, but there is still some piney kick there.

Bottle to glass. Deep murky red with white head. Pine, earthy malt, bread, caramel, and some sort of light fruit I cant quite put my finger on. Persimmons, maybe? Oily mouthfeel, bitter finish, and pretty heavy. One to enjoy slowly.

Nice hoppy bitter after taste. Tinges of malty caramel complements the hops well

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22FL OZ ($5.99) very good flavors here. worth it and then some. so far bear republic has been very good. The red is not over powered but you can distinguish the levels of flavor. slow drinking is the best for this.
Bottle at ATR Bethesda. Red amber body with big tan head. Nose is caramel, malts, fruits. Taste is sweet, hoppier, full-bodied. With some citrus. Bitter finish. Enjoyable.
Bottle to glass. Pours a perfect amber color with a light tan head. Aroma is big piney, citrus hops. Nice crisp amber malts in the flavor. Excellent red ale.
For sure a full bodied amber ale. Almost a big red ale. Loads of delicious malts and then come in the hops. Piney and citrus. Great balance f hops and malts. Excellent beer.

Pours from bottle a hazy red brown with a very thick off-white pillowy head that sticks to the glass in clumps and doesnt fade until the bottom of the glass, and even then, retains a bit of its head. Aroma is a rich malty caramely sweetness and the taste follows the same. Some hoppy bitterness, but the malts win the day here. This is almost a barleywine. Full mouthfeel and bittersweet finish.
Dark red, off white head. Smooth texture. Coffee, heavy malt. Sweet, bready scent. Thick but pretty good.

Aroma: caramel, citrus, spruce, 
Appearance: clear dark amber, tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, sticky texture, 

Tasty. I wonder why the 10 year gap in awards for this?

Bottle from Safeway in Redwood City, CA. Pours a dark cloudy amber with off-white head. Aroma is caramel, vanilla, fruity malts with underpinnings of light hop pine. Creamy / oaty mouthfeel with a bitter finish.
Tap at the source. Pours red amber, off white head. Hop forward Aroma, tropical notes, caramel malt sweetness. Flavor is mango, papaya, sweet caramel and malt, then brown sugar. Bitter finish.
One of the examples of red ale I tried. I found it generally enjoyable, and found it added to my preference for this beer style.
Bitter-sweet and caramel flavor. Rich creaminess. Okay but nothing special.

Aroma caramel, floral, spruce, citrus, 
Appearance red, brown, hazy, cloudy, frothy, tan foam, 
Taste light sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate medium body, lively, bitter, 
Overall I would suggest this beer to a friend
This pours a dark amber color with a foamy beige head. The aroma is sweet and malty. The flavor is complex with lots of bitterness to compliment the malty aroma. Bold, flavorful, and interesting.

Pour is a deep mohogany, cloudy, with a off white head. A beautiful beer. Aroma is rich caramel malt with some earthy and spicy tones. Taste is similar, but a nice hop bite is present. Extremely rich, a lovely beer.

Bottle. Pours rich ruby character with creamy off-white head. Aroma is caramel and bready malts, floral and light citrus notes, and faint spice. Flavor is rich malt character with a heavy dose of hops, light woodiness, and good earthy spice notes. Medium body and carbonation.

Red body, cloudy, really nice. Full aroma, hoppy, pine, caramel and biscuit hops, concentrated fruit, modern. Rich, very rich flavour for the abv, almost barley wine levels. Lovely mouth feel too. Impressive brew, American and modern as I hoped and it really delivered on packing punch per sip. (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière)
Bottle in the Swan in the Rushes, Loughborough. Pours a cloudy ruby with a cream head. Sweet to begin with caramel and pineapple. Really good and full bodied.
bottle poured into a tulip glass..amber color with a fluffy white head..aroma of caramel,citrus,pine..crisp,hoppy,resinous,slightly sweet..good stuff.

From a bottle. Pours hazy tawny brown with a thick bubbly beige head. Tastes malty, nutty, like caramel, resin, earthy, and grassy citrus hops. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells malty, boozy, earthy, musky, and like sweet doughy malt

22oz bottle, dark amber-red color, with a thick pillowy beige head, with a nice fruity yeast, bready, toasted, caramel malty nose, with a mild spicy floral leafy, citrus hoppy, lemon pie crust, toffee, toasted bread crumb accent, and a faint lemon marmalade, french toast, bitter almond, mint leaf, lemon tea leaf note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a very nice fruity, yeasty, candied lemon, lime, grapefruit rind, soft flowery leafy, grassy, minty, citrus hoppy, toasted, biscuity, caramel, bread malty character, with some toffee, lemon pie crust, toasted bread crumb, mint leaf, caramel cookie dough, lemon marmalade, lemon tea leaf flavours, leading towards a candied lemon, lime peel zestiiness, biscuity, toasted, caramel, bread maltiness, good lingering minty, leafy, citrus hop bitterness finish.
Bottle. Brown colour. Sweet, raisiny caramels, pines, soft malty. Full, slight oily, soft bitter body. Pines, citrus. Nice, powerful ipa. Dipa really, or barley-ipa.-- bb
Bottled. Crystal malt and very dry hopped flavours. Lightly spiced. Leaves a very dry taste in the mouth. Solid US ale.

Color caramelo limpio y espuma canela compacta y duradera. Aromas de caramelo, maltas, melocotón, naranja y pino. Cuerpo medio, inicio acaramelado y afrutado de naranja intenso con final de amargor equilibrado resinoso.
Bottle from saveur-biere. Dark red color. Thin head. Balanced taste. Aroma is malty and hoppy.

From bottle to pint glass. Also used in the drip pan for moisturizing the turkey!! Aromas of muted caramel and slight floral hops. Slightly hazy deep amber with full tan head that lingers throughout. Taste is rich malt and strong biscuit cookie. Moderate low bitterness. Floral hops become more pronounced as it warms. Dry finish.

Bottle from whole foods naples florida. Pours ruby red with one finger tan head. Aroma is honey, caramel, spruce, pine. Full on toffee chewy caramel, butterscotch flavour with grassy hop bitterness. Wood molasses dry aftertaste. Pretty good.

not sure how to review this. havent had one in a while as it seems they dont have a great shelf life. 50% spoiled when bought at a store. when its good though...its freakin awesome. HUGE hop aroma and flavor, followed by a big malt body. Awesome beer...wish it was always fresh."
Bomber. Reddish caramel pour with tan head. Caramel and molasses in the aroma. Taste is sweet with hoppy after taste. Smooth creamy body. Nice red ale.

Bronz színére vaskos, bézs hab telepszik, illata csak úgy árasztja magából a remekebbnél remekebb fenyőgyantás, ebből fakadóan némi karácsonyi hangulatot idéző aromákat, melyek között ugyancsak megjelenik az édes tejkaramella, valamint a dió és dohány fűszerezettsége is. A scotch ale-ekre általában jellemző barley wine-szerű illatok tehát ez esetben is erősen munkálkodnak, az imperial stoutokra jellemző szivárványszínű összetettség egy efféle darabnál is megfigyelhető kissé visszafogottabb és komlóközpontú formában. Bársonyos, apró, de simogató buborékokkal megélénkített kortyok során nyerhetünk bebocsátást a fajsúlyos előadásra, amelyben a kekszes, enyhén whisky-s malátás alapokból egy izgalmasan sokszínű, mégis magabiztosan összeszedett gyantás komlóépítmény emelkdeik ki. A konstrukciót kedvesen színezi ki a karamella és az aszalt gyümölcsök, kevés sárgabarack édessége, hogy aztán végleg átadják a helyüket a hosszan elnyúló komlós utómunkának.

Scottish red ale? Its a new one on me, but my first impression is that it may carry a wee bit of the famous Islay phenolics without it actually being a fault. I move on: looks to be red amber in colour with a good carpet of marshmallowy cream coloured head. Heady aromas of orchard fruit, hoppy redwood and spruce resin make this an enticing ale. The flavours are reflected thusly and have a spiciness and piquancy arising from the bitterness that is extremely enjoyable. In fact, I havent had many belches as pleasing recently. Yum.
Bottle in Florida. Called an amber due to color maybe? Tastes much thicker and hoppier. Read label afterwards. Scotch ale wannabe is right
Dark amber, a lightly spiced sweetish aroma. Big, big malt taste with very light smoke. Thick and chewy, like an ice cream soda.

Rated on 7-04-2012 (Bottle-Sicilianos Market-Grand Rapids, MI) The appearance is a medium sized semi-fizzy beige head with a long retention, amber transparent body, very fizzy, fast rising carbonation, and a fair amount of lacing. The aroma is caramel malt, pine hops, and spice. The flavor is sweet, spice, caramel malt, pine and some citrus hops. The mouthfeel is mild carbonation and this beer is medium bodied. This beer has a lingering hoppy aftertaste, worth trying and a beer I would drink again.

Bottle in a hotel room in Las Vegas. Hazy brown to amber pour, creamy off-white head. Aroma of caramel, licorice, citrus, floral hops, resin and some biscuits. Flavor is very nicely balanced, bitter floral hops, sweet caramel malts and smooth with a huge body and lively carbonation. Great brew.

A decent enough red/amber ale, but like most of their stuff it was top hoppy for my tastes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma was very mild. Appearance was a dark reddish hue. Taste was Good. Appropriate for a red ale. Palate had a nice finish.

Hazy deep brown with red hues. Dank nose of meaty citrus and pine with toasted malt and light raisin. Flavor is a mix of citrus and grapefruit with toasted malt and caramel. Faint notes of dark fruit. Lingering burnt toast and citrus.

Bomber! Pours a beautiful translucent dark copper color, a little hazy, with good lacing. Aroma is sweetbreads, lots of rich malts. Taste is bitter on the nose, then sweet, then bitter again. Its definitely "bastardized" - I dont think the scots would know what to do with this much hops! Definitely "fresh" tasting, I can see why so many people like it!
Draft. Ok nose. Just kind of bland toffee and sugar. Not much hop. Really just not that memorable.
Bottle at home. Pours reddish brown, light citrus, fruity, sweet, bitter, toffee malt.

Healthy brown pour with strong red hue and half inch of light brown head. Sweet scent, powdery carmel, spruce and butter. Soft carbonation, frothy mouthfeel, crisp finish that leaves the teeth dry. Flavor of pine and spruce hops, very nutty malt, Carmel too, some rye. Nice scotch ale, not too sweet and fairly complex with nice hop profile.

15 June 2014, tap. Orange/brown/amber. Nose is light toasted malt Nd grassy hops. Thin body and mildly fizzy. Caramel malt and dominant pine hops. Pretty good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Was very anxious to try this one as I am a big fan of the Modern Times Blazing World and this beer was ranked higher amongst ambers. Very let down. Little to no aroma. Mouth feel like a domestic light beer. Tasted like a glorified Newcastle. IMHO not worth even a try.
Caramel, floral, earthy. Its been a while since Ive sampled this one. Will make it a point to sample it again ASAP.

Poured from 12oz bottle. Fantastic deep red color with an ivory head. Nose suggests hints of pine and spruce. Opening dances with a strong malty backbone, then the hops creep in and slap you silly. Really nice offering and a great style. 

--you've been Dubbed.
Tap at Houston beer feat. Brown reddish body (though poured in a plastic cup) with a lot of head. Caramel, nuts. Light to medium body. Short with slightly bitter finish

Refigerated 12 oz. brown bottle poured into an English pint glass. Pours clear crimson with finger and half off-white head. Aroma is caramel malt, medium body, medium carbonation, and medium lacing. Taste is Scottish caramel malt, herbal hops, and bitter finish.
Dommage que jai bu cette bière dans la même soirée que la el diablo du lièvre. La Red Rocket Ale est rafraichissante mais sans arrière gout, après que la gorgé est prise les saveurs se dissipent

Quite a sweet and malted aroma which I found very intriguing, the ruby appearance with a little head is very attractive too. For its colouring Id expect a very malted and earthy taste, and while you get bits of that theres also a strong taste of hops. A really interesting brew, definitely recommended.

Hopped up (American style?) amber ale. 

Not overpowering hops but very strong. Red in color, but bitter in taste. 
Very different the fat tire that preceeded this and is actually lending more points to Fat Tire. 

Disclaimer : not a fan of hops.
Bottle 355ml from AbM @ home. Pours hazy dark amber with a beige head. Sweet malty caramel aroma, some hops. Sweet, resin malts, bitter, caramel flavor.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig fruchtig, reifes Obst. Geschmack nach reifen Obst, malzig, trocken, fruchtig, Dörrobst.

bottle at home from ales by mail
hazy dark amber with a dark beige head, lots of pine and dank hops. full bodied, moderate carbonation, sticky toffee apple malt balanced well by resinous pine hops and some citrus pith. just how i like my american ambers. good stuff.

Very nice reddish brown pour, head quickly disipates. Citrus, resiny hops meld into a great toasted caramel malt flavour. Body is rich, with loads of sweet bread that is backed by a prominent bitterness.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2014 Pours a brownish red with a huge head. Aroma is Sweet roasted malt and citrucy hop notes. Taste follows the Aroma well with some spices upfront and hop notes lingering on the back end. Medium mouth feel very smooth. Awesome Brew!

Pretty damn good. Great bold taste. Nice malt/ citrus nose. Palate lingers with a wonderful bitter finish. Must try. Im sad that Bear Republic is pulling out of the great state of Michigan. Lucky for us we have many great beers to drown our sorrows in. Maybe well see you again Bear......
A very good beer with enough hops and malts to enjoy both worlds. Dark amber with a red tint and medium cream colored head. Aroma is hops and brown sugar. Hoppy,sweet and just good beer.

Pours dark brown with a one finger off white head. Aroma is all citrus and hops. Taste is kind of like a Scottish Ale on steroids. Its a dark ale with a ton of hop taste. Bitter on the back end. Not bad.

I like this one. The aroma is mostly hops, which made me leery to try it, not being a fan of happy beer. But the taste is nicely balanced between hops and malt. You get the hop flavor at the front, but it smooths out at the finish. Each sip intensifies this. Slightly stronger than I prefer but I was pleasantly surprised by this one.

Bottle. Smells wonderful, but hard to place aroma. Sweet and full. Ale is murky, dark amber in the glass, with almost no head. Taste follows the aroma, with something sweet at the end. Feels heavy and full. Ends up just a little more bitter than Id like.
Bottle - dark amber with light beige head. Aroma of hops, roast malts, dark fruits, sweet malts, caramel, coffee. Same for the taste. Lovely mouthfeel, medium bodied, well balanced. Excellent.
355ml bottle from Utobeer. Pours mahogany brown with some resinous, rosy hops and a tickling citrus bitterness on the finish. Nice.

pours unclear dark copper-reddish with a small light beige-orange head, some retention and lacing. pine and citrus, spicy toasted fruity maltiness - slightly nutty with a caramel touch, strawberries, pepper, oranges, hint of dirt, touch of tropical mangoes - slightly danky. moderate carbonation, light body - oily, bittering spicy-citrusy finish. just a tad linear but balanced and tasty. enjoyed.

Clear amber pour with a thin off white soapy head and lots of sticky lacing ... aroma of caramel malts, tea and earthy hops with lightly toasted malts and faded citrusy hops .... taste is of earthy and tea light hops, with some bitter citrusy hops, caramel malts, toasted malts and simple .... has a nice lingering dry malty and bitter bite to the finish

This is one of my all time favorite beers! If your a fan of Stone's Arrogant Bastard I would highly recommend this beer.  Pours a very dark amber. Off white head last long. Aroma of plum and dark cherry hit the nose first followed by woodsy notes. Taste of bitter cherry, dark chocolate, pepper and oak. The bitterness is strong and lingers. Good stuff.
Decent beer. Has a bit of a fruity taste and a bit of a syrupy texture. Good and drinkable.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2014 What is this and why do I love it so? Amber ale...kind of. More like a red IPA. Poured from bottle. Dark caramel reds in the glass with a good sized off-white head. Nice lacing. Mostly candied malt on the nose, with a little hops presence. Taste is pine, chewy bread and roasted malt, rounded out with a pleasant bitter finish. This is a genre buster that works.
Old rate. Draft. Just another worthless amber ale that rots on shelves around here.
Bottle. Plum and caramel aroma. Flavour is initially fruit and caramel malt before a hop led bitterness takes over. Good but probably not fresh enough for me to experience the whole beer.
Huge red! Every thing is perfect other than the maltiness is overwhelming the hop profile I love in red brews. Try it!
Deep amber pour. Aroma is bread, caramel, citrus. Really smooth. Big and bready with great citrus hop balance. Toast, caramel, and grapefruit flavours. Tasty.

Pours a leathery brown color with an yellow head which dissipates quickly. Poor lacing. Quite interesting aromas - grapefruit, bubblegum and leather. Rich palate which excited all areas of the tongue. Overall, a darn nice red ale!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ruby pour with a dirty white head. Hoppy aromas with a bread, nutty and toffee caramel backbone. Leafy, grassy, resinous, with berries, pine and caramel. Very very moreish

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2016 Spiced malt nose, with a touch of caramel. Taste dominated by spiced malt with a roasty and biscuity finish. Some deep brown sugar, molasses and dark fruit with solid bitterness in the finish.

Bottled. Pours clear and deep amber with a average sized, off-white head. Aroma of caramel, grapefruit and orange. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily text. and soft carb. A nice brew indeed.

Bottle from an off licence in Ely. Poured ruby with a tight off white head. Bitter hop resin in the aroma with notes of berries and floral hints. Initial flavours of molasses, spicy hop and fruit rind. Finish was pine needles, treacle and chewy malt.

This beer has a pretty strong caramel aroma with some citrus hops, red color, hazy, minimal thin head, medium sweetness, salty taste and lightly bitter, medium body, thick feel, average carbonation, astringent finish. Im not sure if I would serve this without warning that it isnt the kind of red ale that Im used too - it is somewhat sweet and not as strong as say a Killians.

Hazy toffee colored pour. Small light tan colored head. Little bit of lacing. Huge aroma of piney, floral hops. Taste is a nice citrus and sweet malt. A little bitterness to round it out. Nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12 fl oz bottle ( hey america go metric already) big hoppy aroma like an ipa deep red in colour ram head taste is a bitter malty ale that is very satisfying well do bear republic

Dark reddish brown about a quarter inch of brownish white head that laces glass. Smells of hops, caramel, citrus and pine. Tastes of bitter hops, pine and grapefruit with small notes of malt and caramel. Heavy body with light carbonation.
UPDATED: JAN 12, 2014 This beer reminds me of an IPA. It tastes very similar to Troegs Nugget Nectar with a slightly lighter taste, but a touch more bitter.

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured dark brown a bit reddish with a nice tan head. Aroma of malts, caramel and hints of hops (citrus and floral). Taste of malts with a boatload of hops, nice bitter and sticky finish. Very interesting beer, very enjoyable but very strong too.
Poured from 1 pint (6 fl oz) bottle. Clear medium brown with minimal beige head. Caramel and hops aroma with some malt. Taste is quite toasted malt and hops, grapefruity, dry finish. Medium body.

Bottle from Antenna America, 6.8% It pours a burnt amber brown with a thin tan head. The nose is an appetizing caramel & citrus with floral notes. Great creamy full mouthfeel with zesty citrus, caramel & biscuity qualities to it. A really kick ass American amber ale. In terms of the style Id say it is darker than average & hoppier than average but it is a truly delicious amber ale.

Bottle shared with Kermis at Dukes Brew and Cue. Poured a clear dark brown with a thin broken white head. The aroma is caramel resin hop. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with a treacle toffee resin palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

average creamy frothy offwhite head. mostly diminishing. good lacing. clear thick dark reddish-amber body. aroma: heavy hoppy, wood, nutmeg, alcohol, mate tea, peppermint. if: moderate sweet heavy bitter. ff: light sweet heavy bitter; long duration. palate: medium body, oily texture, medium carbonation, metallic light alcoholic finish. Amargor fortíssimo de lúpulo, a La IPA, condimentado, apimentado, e lembrando casca de laranja, dulçor de chá, não esconde o álcool, cerveja picante, lembra noz-moscada, leve aquecimento alcoólico. Me parece fugir do estilo no entanto, apesar de interessante. Dulçor traz também toques de caramelo.100 s

Bottle shared with Jmgreenuk at The Duke. Pours clear amber brown with an off white head. Aroma is massive malty, caramel, toffee, butterscotch. Flavour is over moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

I have a really hard time classing this an amber ale. Its a red IPA or a hoppy red ale or a bastardized Scottish ale, as the commercial description suggests, it something - but not an amber. Nose is dominated by sweet caramel malt, where a taste turns to mostly sticky pine aromatic hops with some bittersweet orange overtones. Tasty, but rather tacky on the palate. Overall tasty, but not multi-dimensional enough to be really outstanding, and too heavy on the palate to warrant drinking more than one at a time.
Pours red/amber with little to no head. Smells of yeast, hops, caramel, and malts. Tastes of bitter, hops, malts, and slight sour on the back end. Has light/medium carbonation and is very refreshing.

Poured to NB globe.

A: Dark red, almost brown with minimal translucency. Single finger, tan head dissipates almost immediately. Surprising lacing which is cobweb in nature.

S: Plenty of caramel malts, some black malt, sweet and decent amount of hops here. Citrus and light in tone. Almost vanilla feel here. Anticipate a relatively creamy/velvety feel here.

T: More bitter than I had expected. Good warm and grainy flavors. Not impressive for a Red.

M: medium/heavy body with medium carbonation. Good feel. Slicks the tongue and also numbs a hare. Reminds me of an ESB.

D: Quite drinkable. Could have more than one. I imagine if the beer was fresher (assuming not fresh given that the bottle has no date on it), it would be much, much better. Too bad.

Serving type: bottle

02-23-2011
Bottle. Dark amber colour with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of malt, caramel, hops and fruit.

Excellent ale - nod to Scotland for sure - toasty malt very quickly tempered by great herbal hops - no hint of the highish abv - so easy to drink for a full bodied ale. Stratospherically above usual amber or Scottish. Very well done BR, love your work.
Pours a dark amber colour with a beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, toffee, citrus and hops. Taste is high sweet leading to a balsy bitter finish. Awesome!
Good malty caramel aroma. Pours clear reddish brown. Great balanced flavor with a long hoppy finish.

Bottle from Hay Wines, Ledbury, Herefordshire. Clear amber colour. Halo of pale tan head. Aroma is a fusty, caramel maltiness. A heavy hop background. Taste is dirty bitterness. Some fusty fruit. Back of the mouth, bitter finish. Ive a feeling this isnt as fresh as it ought to be.

Cor de mogno escura com pouca formação de espuma e boa persistência. Aroma cítrico e floral, malte e caramelo ao fundo. Sabor inicial com amargor lupulado, cítrico seguindo de dulçor de malte com final seco e com amargor persistente. Muito boa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured into a shaker pint. Pours a dark amber with nice head. Smell is very nice a sweet citrus. Taste is where this was off for me. Not bad just not great. Maybe i got a bad bottle, but not my favorite beer form Bear, Not overlt bitter.
Bottle - fair size foamy head, nice dark amber color, dry earthy hop aroma and flavor, with an almost smokey caramel malty backbone - very good, definitely much better than your typical amber ale

Bottle. Aroma is somewhat strong with sweet grain, syrup, pine and orange. 

Taste has a bit of roasted malt, mainly consisting of bread, hops and citrus. Little oily but velvety overall on the mouth, with a bitter middle and finish.

FROM NOTES: August 7, 12
On draft at the Yard House-San Jose, poured into a half-yard glass. 

A: Faint aromas of sweet malt, lightly roasted caramel, mixed with an undertone of citrus hops.
A: Pours a deep, chestnut red with two fingers of substantial head that dissipates quickly and leaves heavy lacing. 
T: Strong, bold floral and sweet flavors give way to a crisp and sharp hop bitterness in the finish. 
P: Medium body and lively moderate carbonation, crisp and clean. It is an easy drinking beer with a nice flavor profile and is well balanced. 
O: Fairly well balanced, but a little watery. Still a good beer, but definitely could do better.

Pint at the Biergarten at LaGuardia airport. Really deep, ruddy brown. unfiltered looking. Deep sweet brown caramel and brown sugar malting, with good hit of hops. Great brown ale, some fruit leather and chalky tobacco. Sweet finish with some fruit-pine hops. Solid drinker, big flavor.
On tap at wolfgang puck..mgm grand.. dark red vlear pour with small kchki head..hoppy arona...taste is hoppy clean smooth sone grapefruit

Im a stout kinda guy and I do like a hoppy IPA, but none were available and I was told that there was a limited supply of Red Rocket available on tap so I tried it and was very pleased. About 6 months later (OCT 2013) we were in Napa Valley and stopping for a bite to eat and found (just by coincidence) the brewery; what a pleasant surprise.
~This review was made some time ago via another application, and thus the specific details (beyond numerical scores) are no longer available~

Appearance was clear deep red gold with creamy lasting white 1 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are sweet toffee, mild malts with slight roasty, grain, rye, cracked wheat, hints of citrus hops and pine, no alcohol. Taste are soft caramel, roasty, toasted rye malts upfront with a smooth soft grapefruit, orange, lemon bitterness. Palate was soft smooth CO2 with medium body, then roasty, fruity, balanced lasting finish. A wonderful smooth red.

Cloudy brown on pour with filmy head. Not looking too good until beer hits mouth. First confusion, Scotch ale? Or IPA? Then melding. It's both. Lovely richness followed by high stringency. Well worth it. Appearances aren't everything.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of citrusy hops. The taste is big and bold. A lot of citrus hops and some caramel in the background. Either bitter or sweet but balanced. Medium carbonation.

On tap at Joe Canals West Deptford.
Appearance: Slightly hazy burnt copper body with a tan foamy head, settling into a messy coating.
Aroma: Hints of caramel and other sweet malts with prominent orange.
Taste: Complex malt base of brown sugar, bread, caramel, and cocoa, with a mildly bitter orange and tangerine.
Palate: Medium bodied, moderately carbonated.
Overall: Solid red ale, could use a stronger aroma. Very nice to drink though.
Bottle. Deep garnet with a big, beige head. Caramel and sweet hop aromas. Nice, light bitterness and light mouthfeel. Really good.

HQT night. Bottle. Not bad for a bottle. A little thick, chewy. Smelt like a Christmas tree. Maybe hints of chocolate. This beer had so many taste and aromas that it was distracting. Certainly it is not a blend beer... just a lot going on. Maybe to much.
12 fl oz bottle courtesy of Stuartyboy - brown ale with a marginal haze, good bubbly cream head, sweet malty aroma, sporadic lacing, caramel, fruity, smooth, dry finish, very easy to drink

I am not versed in the scottish red ale that they claim to be copying, but I do know that this beer is more earthy than their racer 5 IPA. Ive had Oskar blues old chub, and this is quite a bit more hoppy than that one. The caramel malts are there as promised, but the most noticeable things about the beer are the earth tones and a good balance of hop and malt. Not fantastic, but above average.

Pours a dark mahogany color with a decent head that fades to bits of lacing. Aroma is a bit on the mild side with roasted malt, some dark fruit, bit of caramel and spice. Taste of roasted malt, bit of caramel sweetness and fruit, with a trace of spice in the background. Mild bitterness and a clean finish with a bit of hops tart lingering. Moderate body, smooth and creamy with the 6.8 ABV well hidden. The hops give the beer a bit of character missing from most Amber Ales. Enjoyable beer well worth checking out.

Pours a dark red almost brown with a generous light tan head and lots of lacing down the glass.

Smells of sweet malts with a little bit of citrus.

Good hop bite up front rounding into a brown sugar like sweetness on the back end. Almost a little astringent on the finish. Not sure if that is the right off flavor, but something definitely leaves my palate wincing at the end.

Mouthfeel is a light and carbonation is medium. Way too light for how dark the beer is.

Not nearly as good as the Hop Rod Rye. Not a total drainpour, but I dumped it after half so I could have a beer that was good.
Overall pretty good amber ale, bottle from bevmo, rich, and easy to drink, solid
Amber pour. Caramel and ?? In aroma. Taste is sweet and caramel. Too much hops for an amber

Pours very dark clear copper color. Aroma is very subdued. A sour bite in the initial taste. Body is substantial. Feels like it should be stronger than the stated 6.8%ABV.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Rabbies Drams Ayr a deep red brown ale with strong alcohol content very fruit with soft carmel sweetness significant hop profile and big zing in the finish with limited bitterness

330ml bottle @ home. Sweet but not so strong smell. Pretty and tight foam mattress and colour is ruby red. Taste is little bit hoppy and fine balanced.
Should be colder.. took too early from fridge :-)

Overall something still missing?

Bottle at home from Ales by Mail UK. Pours dark amber with a large frothy lacy off-white head. Aroma is lots of caramel, malty, floral, spicy and creamy. Taste is really smooth and creamy. Not very bitter, medium sweetness. Finish is lingering smooth, creamy. Full bodied with average carbonation. Great beer.
February 2012. 22 oz. bottle. Caramel aromas with dark malt, light fruit. Amber color with a white head. Caramel and toffee flavors with hops on the finish.
Brown red qith off white head. Aroma sweet roasted caramel. Taste follows nose. Descent red.
Sweet malty aroma, complex taste of malt, hops, and fruit. Hint of bitterness on the palate.
Poured from a cold bottle. Murky light brown color, no head. Sweet malt smell. Taste like it smells.
Bomber. Pours a dark amber with a frothy tan head. Aroma of caramel, roasty, and some fruits. Tastes a little hoppy and sweet.

Pours a dark amber color with a light khaki head that does not really leave, smells of pines and citrus with a bit of malt to be sensed in there. Taste up front in malty with a bit of caramel and then it turns into a hop assault, lots of hops with large piny/citrusy character that bites a bit in the end
Bottle from Fine Wine Co. Amber copper. Big on malt. Good balance of malt and hop taste wise. Little heavy palate. Good hop finish.

Pours amber and clear with light tan head that ambles away gradually. Aroma is caramel and citrus. Tastes malty with caramel into piney mildly citrus creamy hop. Less bitter off the palate than an IPA with more malt upfront. Not the hugest amber fan but this is a good one. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle - Aromatic hops and sweet caramel malts. Clear amber with a beige thick head. Sweet bubblegum and caramel with a nice bitterness to balance. Overall nice hoppy amber.
Tap. Amber with light tan head. Aroma is malt, fruit, and a light pine. Taste is light bitter with sweet malt and some pine.

Had this one tap at the sail. Pours a red amber colour with a thick creamy off white head. Nose is heavy on caramel malts and citrus. Nice ipa hop presence. More toffee/caramel malts in the taste with that citrus hop bitterness clinging all the way through. Love the citrus shining through this one. Really good stuff.

Draft at the Syb Pig in Boca. Tulip. Amber unfiltered pour with two finger white head. Great spider web lacing. Aroma of caramel malts, nuts, and leather. Taste of roasted malts, nuts, caramel and toffee. Balanced well with hops. Medium carb. Hippy bitter finish.

Bomber bottle poured a hazy orangish-brown w/ small particles (unfiltered and bottle conditioned), it had a small frothy slowly diminishing tan head. Huge wonderful aromas of caramel, nutty malts, cereal, and hop perfume. Initial flavor is a moderate sweet w/ a moderate bitter of long duration. Tastes are similar to the nose, caramel, cereal, rye, grass, and sweet orange citrus. Medium bodied, creamy texture, and soft carbonation.

Surprisingly smooth considering the ample hop flavor and bitterness. Notes of caramel, lots of malt, delicious melanoiden. More like a red ipa than an amber, which is why i love it. Good to push the palate towards IPAs.
This beer has substance, for sure. I am sensitive to overly bitter beers, and this was not.

Pours golden amber. Nose is a bit dank with notes of dark fruits and citrus . Its of caramel and toasted malt on the front with fruity esters and pleas to of hop bitterness on the back. Finish is vanilla and black cherry.
Had on draft at the brewery. Caramel, fruity, fruit loops like, caramel, toast, not bad. Tasty beer.

On tap at Toronado. Subtle berries on the nose. Belgiany. Pours a very dark red brown. Good strong red flavor but flat finish.

Draught @ Toronado, San Francisco, CA
Pours hazy amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, biscuit, citrus ang grape. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long caramel and fruity finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

On tap @ toronado, SF. Press amber with a small off white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, floral and citrus hops and fruitiness. Flavor is sweet and bitter with some malt, caramel, biscuit and fruitiness. Medium body, average carbonation.

Hopheads rejoice! I really enjoyed this "bastardized Scottish Ale". Poured a nice deep amber color with a nice white head that laces nicely. Smells of hops and caramel. Great taste, long lasting finish.

Pours a deep ruby amber with a minimal white head. Aroma is sweet & fruity. Taste is like the color. A balanced blend of deep malts & pine-like bitterness. Definitely a "wet" beer, because the finish just drops off.
Pours a dark amber color with off white head. Caramel, malt, hop, toffee and fruity aromas. Caramel, toffee, malt, grapefruit and hop flavors. Medium body and carbonation and a bitter, malty finish.
Great thick malty and hoppy. Aroma of caramel, grapes, and pine. Flavor is sugar and grapefruit. Body is really full and thick.

Pours a deep reddish-amber with a finger length, off-white head that dissipates into a cap. Cherries, raspberries, licorice, and resinous hops are all present. Strong maltiness on the tongue, slightly bitter finish that lingers. Medium bodied, thick mouthfeel. As interesting as the label would suggest, and would recommend to anyone.

22oz bottle. Pours reddish brown with a white head. Toffee, caramel, pine, grapefruit. Awesome hop forward amber ale.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2013 This is the best red ale Ive ever had. Really flavorful with a nice hop presence and a caramel backbone
12 oz bottle. Pours red/brown with medium head. Aromas of roasted malts, toffee, and sour dark fruit. Flavours are similar with chewy malts and an acidic bitter hoppy finish.
Good aroma. Hoppy. Red in color. Strong hop flavor in the forefront then ends malty and sweet. Good beer, will buy again, always love a good ale!

Dark red brown, medium head, decent lacing. Pine aroma. First sip is hoppy, then sweet malts follow, pine bitter finish. Medium body, that starts rich, middle kinda watery and end malty creamy and pine tangy finish. Not too sweet nor too bitter. Nice. Recommended.

Balanced hop aroma with a red appearance, smooth taste and a mild mouthfeel.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2013 Bottle from Laura Alberts. Daniel Island, SC. Pours a beautiful hazy red. Minimal head with a sweet aroma. Nice hop flavor makes me think of a red IPA.

Bottle at the Blind Monk.  Clear amber pour with an off white head.  Sweet malty aromas.  Might be a bit old as the grapefruit hop notes are fading and exposing the malty backbone.  Decent body and good carbonation.

Bottle from Asahiya. Big fat malty nose, filled in with typical West Coast greenery. Sweet n sourish initial / mid flattens out and goes to a fairly smooth balance / nice light tanginess that soon clears off and leaves mild hop traces. Very tasty. Aroma promises a lot more than comes out on the palate -- but thats probably a good thing.

Aroma: Pine resin followed by a bit of candy-caramel like notes.
Appearance: Deep reddish brown with a light beige head.
Flavor: Malty, fruity with medium sweetness and a gentle hop bitterness.
Palate: Medium to full bodied with moderate carbonation and malty finish.
Overall: Great flavors and balance. Would go great with a garlicy, roast leg of lamb.

Pretty nice - strong, sweet, bitter aftertaste with some pineapple and lingering caramel. Very sweet on the nose, dark in the glass and slightly syrupy in the mouth. Gets slightly sickly almost boring by the end. Not mega hoppy.

355ml bottle. Clear darkest copper colour with small, creamy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, beige head. Cautious clean hoppy aroma, minimally herbal, floral, hints of bubblegum, peppermint, underlying malty notes with a nuttily touch. Taste is initially clean bitter hoppy without specific flavour, maybe a touch peppermint, later slightly caramel malty, a touch of toffee, burnt coffee. Narrow, constricted, clean, sober, monotonous.
Bottle.  Pours a dark red with some head and spotty lacing.  Tons of hops onthe nose,  caramel and hops are the taste.

Bottle from Hazels beverage world. Deep amber color, beige head. Bitter taste with caramel, nuts, bread, oak and hops. Smooth body with sweet malts and crispy hops. Bittersweet finish with nuts and caramel. Very nice american strong.

On tap at Ridgewood (Raleigh)

Pours amber with a bit of creamy head. 

Bitter hoppy taste, sharp aftertaste. Doesn't work as one of those "nice summer beers" that some of the other hoppy beers I've tried due to the bitterness, but I'd get it again.
