Bomber->SA.  Dark amber with frothy offwhite head.  Aroma: dark sweet malt with citrus hops.  Taste: caramel, molasses, sweet malt, pine.  Good.
Amber color with some nice lacing. Strong hop presence with some tart on the end. Excellent red.

Bottle. Lovely! Pours a ruby red body, little to no head, sweet syrupy  aroma, quite tangy taste, very very sweet middle with a very very light hop finish. As a Scottish themed beer it is quite interesting; I love American IPAs so it really takes on that theme whilst giving a wee look at the Scottish style. Lovely little beer!

355ml bottle. Color is deep mahogany with a thick beige head. Aroma has citrusy notes and dark bread is dominating. Flavor has sweet fruits, dark bread, caramel and nutty notes.  Bitter hoppy finish with caramel and citrusy notes. Quite tasty, medium bodied. Maybe not that fresh, but still enjoyable as it is.

Mixed six from Total Wine.  Dark brown pour with a touch of red, off white head. Sweet caramel with a bit of citrus. Uh, yeah, hits with some bittersweet and finishes with carbonation and leather. Just a wonderful beer.

Clear red beer with an off-white head and a slight fizz to it.  You get a bit of hop and malt in the aroma but its surprisingly ;light on that front. The taste is much stronger though. A big initial hit of hopand then what follows is an ever so slightly fruity malt flavour. The aftertaste is interesting, starting with the malt and then fading and leaving the hop to linger.
wow. cracking beer- just what an amber should be. love the malt body of this one and great support from the hops. palate slightly thin which adds sessionability. id love to see the oaked one!

A - Hazy rusty red brown with an off white head.

S - Thick toffee/caramel malt, sugary strawberries, citrus hops,

T - Citrus off the top before a slab of rich toffee/caramel malt flows in with descent amount of leafy hop bitterness behind it. Some fruit and marshmallow sweetness mixed in as well.

M - Medium to full body, smooth, low carbonation.

Great malt base, very flavorful and satisfying.

Serving type: bottle

09-12-2011

Great hop character with a solid malt backbone. My only criticism is that the dark malts are a little strong on finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hoppy and kinda bitter aroma. Dark amber color with white head. Its floral hop at first taste then takes a leathery direction afterwards. Pretty bomb. Bear Republic rarely lets me down. For some reason this reminds me of something Port Brewing would put out. I dont know if they have similar styles or ingredient choices but that.s what my tongue is telling me.
Bottle. Dark reddish brown with medium head and a little lacing. Aroma of grapefruit and malts. Taste is pine, fruity malts and sweetish. Medium bodied and a little sticky. Quite nice.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: 12oz bottle pours a reddy brown color. Great blend of hops and malt flavors.

I spent a good 6 or 7 lost in the aroma there is so much going on. Taste is the same. Layered with green apple, plums, maybe even a slight hint of wasabi. Body is light and oily and well suited to the overall structure. What a beer.

Pours dark red with frothy tan head. Aroma is full of both resiny hops and sweet caramel tones. Sweet with an astringent crisp finish. The body could be a bit fuller but overall this a very delicious bear. Bear Republic does it again
12oz bottle, Bottled in 09/12 so a touch old at 8 months but still holding up well, some lingering hop flavor with a touch of caramel malt.. not as sweet as I thought it would be. worked for me.

Bottle.  Beautiful, intensely hoppy nose, dense and pungent with light dank notes, orange and light pine, dough.  Deep copper pour is a bloody ruby under light, tan head.  Taste is semi-dry with strong bitterness, that great stripping quality thats sure to make it a good mach for greasy pizza.  Full-bodied hops but the specificity has faded, theres till strong caramel but not getting any real varietal detail.  A bit of scorched earth in the deep background, behind the mild hop oils, utterly no sign of alcohol.  Crisp fullish body, quite clean, a good standard of the wave of a few years ago.
Poured reddish brown/amber with a small tan head. Aroma of sweet caramel malt and dark fruit.. Medium body, flavour of the aroma with sweet toasted malt notes and a dry finish.

Bottle (12 oz). Amber with a medium off-white head and some lacing. Aroma of caramel, grapefruit and slight spices along with sweetness notes. Taste is moderately sweet and malty with caramel, grapefruits and a moderate hoppy finish. Medium body. Balance is only average but its a good beer nonetheless.
Amber and clear. Malty aroma. Solid backbone without being overwhelming. Solid red ale
Brown with a small head.Hoppy with floral tones and a perfume like aftertaste that tasted better than that probably sounds.Distinctive and classy. A pleasure to drink.
Bottle: Dark sienna.  Aroma: Fig, plum/dark fruit, alcohol.  Flavor: dark fruit, semi sweet with a surprisingly smooth tart finish.
Draft at whole foods. Super dark red pour with tiny head. Citrus and biscuit aroma. Carmel flower malty taste. Hoppy. Super good

Bomber. Pours dark mahogany red with a good beige head leaving lacing. Aroma is fruity nutty very malty "heavy" a bit sweet caramel. Flavor is similar to aroma, light in front gaining more body, flavors and bitterness towards the finish. Good strong bitter aftertaste together with the sustained malty body.
Tap at Craft Beer Market Jimbocho, Tokyo. Light brown colour with a tan head. Citric, hops aroma. Flavour is hops, fruity.

Pours a red amber color with no head. Nose is sweet and malty, and fruity. Taste is herbal and almost medicinal, not pleasant. Finish is long and ends on bitter astringent notes.Have had much better strong ales. Quaff Score 4 / 10
Pours a muddy brown with a small head and aroma of hops and caramel. Taste is bitter, of hops, caramel, and toasted malt with a bitter, long finish.

Brown-red with medium tan head.  Aroma malt, caramel, bit of hops. Medium-full body.  No alcohol.  Flavor is a little sweet, malt, caramel, lightly roasted, herbal and pine hops with bitter finish.  Quite good.

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a dark red with a bunch of chunks floating around. Aroma of caramel with herbal and floral hops. Taste is light bitter. Resinous pine and herbal hops. Full bodied with a slightly sticky texture. Lively carbonation and a super long, lasting finish. Overall, pretty good. Im wondering if i may have an old bottle though.
Decent aroma with a decent taste. Not exaggerated long finish. Pretty good anyway. Worth a try.

Poured from a bottle, dark red mahogany pour with an off white head that laces a bit as it goes down.  Smells hoppy mostly with sweet fruitiness. Some caramel in the nose too.  Tastes pretty well rounded. Sweet maltiness up front, balanced with some hops and finishes big on caramel. Its a nice beer.

Aroma: Sweet caramel, strawberry, pine and candied sugar.

Appearance: Slightly hazy reddish brown body with a large beige head. Lively carbonation. Lots of sticky lacing. 

Taste: Beautiful balance between sweet and bitter flavours. Red fruits and kiwi fruits. Slight earthiness and nuttiness. Complex and delicious. 

Palate: Medium body with a slick, oily mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. 

Overall: A soft, interesting, well rounded beer.

Interesting blend of flavors. The aroma was not strong but malty, grains and a little sweet. Nice plum color with minimal head. The palate had some weight and smooth character. The carbonation was a little low but worked. Nice Scottish and peat flavor with malts and some hops on the back end but not as pronounced as what the bottle suggested. The mix of styles worked.

355ml bottle - shared by rosenberg - thanks.
Sweet caramelly malt aroma, laced with coconutty syrup - sorachi arse, perhaps? Supersweet body. sticky. no balance. some thinness, some milkiness.  Hops reinyand biting.

355 ml bottle. 2030. Bottled 01/03/12. Courtesy of VastActiv. 
Amber colour with a tiny off-white head.
Strong malt, alcohol and hoppy bitterness in the aroma.
Bitterness, dark hops, mild malt, mild alcohol and lots of sweetness in the flavour. 
Hmmm... Decent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 0.335l from alesbymail. Colour is brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, caramel, sweetness, hops and malts.

Mmmm, interesting twist to the scotch style.  My only issue is that the hops leave some bitterness lingering instead of the nice sweet malty aftertaste that one would expect.  This beer is still delicious, smells caramely sweet, and has a nice dark red poor.  The hops arent overbearing and you have to enjoy the creativity.  Quite nice!

Pours brown with little head and good lacing. Nose is sweet biscuity. Aromas are caramel, some grassy hops, some biscuit. Tastes are medium sweet with med/light bitterness. Medium body with lively carbonation. Another great offering from this brewery!

Clearing backlog. No comments. Apologies, future ratings will have detail. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Oh the bloody irony. Im not a fan he says back in the summer of 2012. A bit of cold weather and the pressure of getting more than 65% at Level 4 and now its You have to drink these, theyre all great, youll love them. Luckily for Mr Freaky Duck Man I like caramel. Quack.
Bottle at The Ale House, Chelmsford. Red brown in colour, with minimal head. Almost like a fruit beer, strong aroma of strawberry, with biscuit. Sweet. OK, but not as good as Id expected it to be.
Over the top and unbalanced.  Sweet and stewy with too high ABV.  No real discerning style.  Avoid this one as is not great.

Nice aroma, lovely color. Malty with a nice lightly hoppy finish. Very drinkable. Currently on draught at the Lionheart Pub Albany NY, but not for long. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Very hoppy and a full palate with lively carb. A solid offering. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a deep ruby color. Nose is slightly malty with citrus. Taste is loght malt at first then nice bittering from the hops, piney and bitter not much citrus.

Pours a deep, shiny brown with not much head.  The aroma is much like a Scotch ale with some mild caramel apple and bready notes.  The taste is good.  malty, strong, with a little molasses going on and a bit of hoppy burn in the finish.
March 2013 - cold bottle.  Mild, slightly sweet and rich.  Taste is not that great, reminds me of the Stone Arrogant Bastard.  Nothing special.  Below average.

355ml bottle from Ales by Mail

Pours reddish brown with a large foamy head. Aroma of sweet syrupy malts, hints of piney, resiny and grassy hops, caramel, toffee and spices. Taste is sweetish, malty and syrupy with some resiny grassy hoppiness and spicy notes. Finish is hoppy, spicy and malty. Okay, quite balanced.

Dark reddish amber. Creamy off-white head, lasting. Big aroma, sweet, malty, hoppy, caramel, rich fruity, citrus. Medium to full body, oilyish. I felt the sweetness and bitterness was balanced nicely. Somewhat drying. Flavor is quite hoppy, pine, grapefruit, caramel, a little fruity.  Quality brew.

Bouteille 22oz provenant dun échange. De couleur brune et claire. Nez de houblon résineux doux et légèrement citrique, malté de caramel sucré avec des notes de butterscotch et également moyennement fruité (agrumes sucrées, notes de mangues). Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture légèrement crémeuse. Goût léger-moyen amer de houblon résineux, légèrement floral et citrique (pamplemousse doux - une amertume présente en arrière-goût toute la gorgée) avec un goût fruité (agrumes, notes de mangues, traces dabricots) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût malté de caramel sucré doux avec des notes de toffee rôti et de butterscotch puis en finale le houblon reprend progressivement le dessus (plus sec, légèrement plus herbeux. Post-goût long-moyen et aux notes sèches, moyen-léger amer de houblon citrique, moyennement résineux et herbeux avec des notes fruitées (agrumes) et faiblement rôties. (2006)
080313. Bottle at home. Pours dark amber with a nice head. Aroma caramel malts. some hops. Slightly sweet taste. Medium full bodied. Not Bad,

Nice aroma with caramel, coffee, fruit, and spice.  More of the same in the flavor, along with a little more booze than I expected.  Some hop bitterness and a tiny bit of metallic taste in the finish.  This is the first thing Ive tried from this brewery, and I will try more.

AIPA aroma with assertive hops, tannins, grapefruit, pineapple. Dark, cloudy, rusty brew, tan head, leggy/webby on the sides of the glass; great label, standard bomber.  Chalky-sweet first impression with a red ale hoppiness. Grassy notes.  Tannic, bitter finish.  Medium-heavy body.   Whiffs of muted chocolate powder here and there.   Respectable.  Ive been looking forward to this beer for some time, and though not disappointed, Im not awestruck either.  Market Square Liquors, Timberlane.
Ditto PhillyBeer, happy to see these in FL. Deep ruby color with a nose of piney hops and some caramel. Semi sweet up front with a big bitter finish.

Still happy these beers are in Florida. Dark reddish brown, large foamy head. Nose is resinous hops, dark caramel malts, flavor similar, very resinous, big bitter finish, kept in check by a big soft semi-sweet malt profile.
Bottle. Pours dark copper/red with a thin off white head. Aroma is lovely malt, toffee, hops and red berries. Flavour is quite bitter with a dry, long finish. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation.
This beer is right up my alley, full body, delicious hop flavour against a well balanced bitterness.  This is right up there with tall poppy, if you can get Red Rocket on tap - get in amongst it!

Pours a very rich dark reddish-brown. Creamy tan head. Aroma is extremely balanced between sweet caramel/toffee malt with a nice hoppy backnote. Flavor is almost reversed, and drinks more like midwest style IPA. Mouthfeel is a bit sticky, but the bitterness makes this very drinkable. Well done.

10th June 2012Deep red - amber beer. Small pale tan head. Fairly dry palate. Good malt base, streak of dark toffee. Mild cream. Good piney hops, fairly bitter. Trace of red berry fruits. Dry finish with a bitter aftertaste. Quite barleywine like. Well joined up.

Bottle from Tremblking Madness, York. A very dark brown cloudy beer with ruby red highlights. It has rich spicy red fruit, vanilla and liquorice flavours with sarsaparilla and bitterness on the finish. Superb!
Dark reddish-brown colour, with a little head.  Strong taste, somewhat bitter.  Rather tasty.

Translucent dark amber with a thin but persistent creamy beige head.Creamy full body with medium-high carbonation.

aroma: earthy citrus pine hops, lots of sweet caramel crystal malt, chocolate, and a bit of silage.

taste: some carbonic bite and tangy caramel malt right up front, followed by lots of caramel malt sweetness and pungent hop bitterness (they almost balance each other, but inundates my palate in the process), with some roasted malt and citrus hops coming through strong in the finish. does not leave as strong or coating of an aftertaste as i was expecting.

Malts/hops on the nose about 65/35. Dark beer, reddish brown in color. About 1 finger of head, even with a fairly vigorous standard pour. I can't identify the malt but I bet the bill includes many different types; I can't identify the hops, but it's pleasing and tending toward earthiness. MF is medium tending toward heavy. Overall: this beer grew on me as I performed this review. I'm going back right now to raise the score a bit. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Subtle hoppy aroma. The hops are not very bitter there is a nice bitter aftertaste. Oaky taste with a great smoothness on the palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draft from Lizardville: pours clear amber, fluff off white head. Herbal and earth hops, pine, cedar and faint spearmint on the nose. Rich and full bodied, caramel and cereal malt sweetness, toffee, spices, Pacific NW hops on the flavor profile. Mineral hop bitterness on finish. Not outstanding but better as you go along

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours deep copper with small lacey head. Smells of caramel, pine, and bread notes. Taste is malty bread sweetness in the front, dry slightly roasted bitterness in the end. Finishes herbal and grassy through the nose. A flavorful red ale. Would drink this again.
On tap. Poured red with a white head. Malty and sweet, but enough hops to balance it out and give it a nice crisp finish.
Bottle at home. Pours a fantastic, deep red. Malty taste. A bit flat but good beer.

Killer brew. Served at a good temperature with a large, cream-colored - to very light tan, long lasting head. Color is a clear, dark amber brown. with some bubble trails.  Aroma is very fresh hop, a little roast malt & fruit. Flavors similar to nose; again hop stands far forward/, yet reasonably balanced. Body and carbonation are  perfect. Finish is durable but not too long, like flavor, and satisfying while drinkable.
Draught at The Blind Tiger NYC sept 2012. Amber beer with an offwhite head. Fruity, Hoppy and malty aroma. Dried dark fruits, bitter, hoppy and malty flavour.

straight out of a bottle, this beer had a nice smell to it... I could almost taste the beer from the smell and it was accurate once I tasted.  first you tasted the bitterness of it, which was still fairly smooth - I?m not the biggest fan of bitterness - and I then got the sweeter taste of the beer.  I think the description of the beer is accurate.  again, while I?m not a bitter/overly hoppy beer lover, this was good.  it didn?t give me that "no thank you, too bitter" face.  solid.

On tap at The Met in New West. A very dark ruby/amber color, with a light tan head. Hops and malts on the nose. Predominant taste impression is bitter hops, but with big malt backing. Finish is long and bitter. A great winter ale!
roasty, herbs, earthy, smoke, brown, red, hazy, frothy, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, creamy, medium body, full body, average carbonation, bitter,
From a 22 oz bottle shared at home.  Pours a hazy reddish brown with an off white head.  Malty aroma.  Notes of caramel and toffee with a sharp hop undertones.  Bitter finish.
Decent but too malty for my liking............................................ via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle from The BeerHive in Pittsburgh.  Enjoyed every ounce of this tasty Scottish delicacy.  A bit of an IPA taste underneath, but not overpowering as in so many IPAs.  Ill be looking for more of these.
From bottle. Pours copper with thin head. Aroma was wonderful with a malty goodness with a full piney hop and dark fruit balance. Taste follows with a clean boozy finish.

Bottle from Teign Cellars.  Nose has banana, candy, a hint of clove.  Pours amber/brown with no head to speak of.  Flavour is bursting with sweet molasses notes until the bitterness pushes through and adds layers of citric hop complexity.  The lingering finish is somewhat addled, but resolves itself into a pleasing malty dryness that begs another sip.  Not bad.

Beautiful amber pour thin head. Hop heavy aroma but not a overly bitter aftertaste. full body that outs will balanced between market and good. Making me look foward to more bastardized Scottish reds. Paired well with chicken pizza. Overall, i belive this delicious beers "bastard father" tastes like an ipa.
22 oz bottle: Pours dark copper/amber. Aroma of caramel and butterschotch malts, some alcohol. Taste is smooth, complex on the malt side. Would prefer it to have been a little more hoppy.

Pours a murky amber with a thin off-white head. Aromas of earthy hops, spices and grains. Taste has a decent amount of hop bitterness backed by a nice malt balance and finishes pretty dry. Overall Id say this is a solid offering from a brewery that has yet to disappoint. SLAINTE!

35,5 cl bottle @ home, no BBE info
Aroma is nice with resiny hops, some caramel malt and fruits. Flavour is sweet with resiny malt, some caramel, fruits. Amber ale in American way.

355 ml bottle.
Pours dark mahogany color with a large frothy head. Aroma of hops, resin, mild toasted malts, caramel, pine and some fruity notes. Flavor of fruits, hops, caramel, some goose berries and hints of toffee. Bitter and a bit sweet palate. Decent.
4524

Serving: 12 oz. bottle from Total Wine Sterling.  It pours, well, red, with a light tan head.  The nose is very sprucy with light malt notes.  It has a pine dominated taste with nice caramel notes.  Not necessarily balancing, but enough to keep this brew enjoyable.  Medium to full bodied with softer carbonation and a lasting spruce finish.  Tasty stuff.

Pours deep amber ruby with light tan head. Aromas of citrus, pine, sweet malts, caramel and burnt toffee. Medium body, moderate bitterness balanced with a lightly cloying malt body. Finishes balanced on the big malts and hops. Tasty.

Bear Republic Ricardos Red Rocket Ale has a thick, pillowy, beige head, and a murky, sediment-filled, reddish-brown appearance, with some bubble streams and thick lacing left behind. The aroma is of turned fruit and rank hop oil. Taste is of brown bread crust, sweetness, sourness, toffee, hop oil (lots of hop oil), and over-ripe fruit. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy (mostly heavy), and Bear Republic Ricardos Red Rocket Ale finishes mostly dry, sickly-sweet, but highly drinkable. Maybe, my bottle was old (no date on it, however), but this was mostly of musty, oily, oldness. Ill say its on the low end of good, and thats being generous. Too bad. RJT

Wyśmienite piwo, bardzo treściwe i wyraziste w smaku. Finisz rozgrzewający i wytrawny. Na początku lekka nuta owocowa, ale szybko się przekształca w maksymalną gorycz. Piana mogłaby być trochę trwalsza. Ogólnie świetne piwo które jest godne polecenia.
Nice floral aroma, not much head or lacing out of the bottle.  Taste is surprisingly hoppy with decent spice left behind.
bottle. red/amber with small head. amber-style ale with substantial hoppy bite. light spice. pretty decent.

Bottle. Deep brown color. Hoppy amber  taste. Very nice texture. Full body. Bready and yeAsty. Another great hop experiment from bear republic

Aroma is very malty, hints of licorice, roasty, caramel.  Taste follows the aroma with a good hop bite. Short bitterness, some dark fruits. Good
UPDATED: DEC 28, 2012 an interesting beer, flavorful off the front end, but almost nothing on the back, I?ve never had anything like that... a tad too bitter for Me
Bottle: Pours a great looking beer. However, though there is a big flavour it is not very pleasant. The finish is poor and lacking.

bomber from consumers beverages in niagara falls, shared with jsprime and joel. deep red, tan head. big malty nose with aged resinous hops. flavour is malt forward, late, spicy hop bitterness. nice complex big red ale.
Ooooo. This one is pretty nice.  Reddish brown appearance with decent lacing.  Medium bodied with a slightly oily mouthfeel.  Caramel and dark fruit body with a nice hop bite throughout.
Red brown colour. Sweet malty aroma with some yeast too. Flavour is a bit spicy, yeasty with a nice caramel sweetness.

Pours dark brown with red hues and a small off white head. Nose is caramel, molasses, brown sugar, hay and dark fruits. Taste is sweet with a great bitter balance that carries through until a very bitter finish. Mouthfeel is soft and creamy, body is heavy and finish is long.

Pours a browny red, almost dirty ruby colour with a thin light tan head which soon disapates but remains around the edges. 

Smell - immediate smell of raisins with a bit of prunes

Taste - winter fruits little of of a plum or Blackwell tart. Little bit of soap soap. With hints of sweet toffee, frangipan 

I'd quite like to throw it over a sticky toffee pudding cheese cake

Bottle poured into glass. Dark murky color, good carbonation and head retention. Floral hoppy aroma with slight hints of grapefruit. Malty on the back end but has a very nice balance.
Clear red pout with a two finger head.  Some lace.  Sweet caramel aroma.  Thick mouth.  Taste is full of sweet caramel.  Hops dont tone done the sweetness much.
Bottle. Nice creamy head with excellent duration. Color is dark amber. Aroma and taste are rich hops, caramel, fruits, flowers and malt.

Brownish red in color... Aroma of caramel malts and citrus hops... Flavor is dry for a red ale, caramel malts, slightly bitter finish... Solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep red brown pour with a thick pale brown head. Big caramel smell, bread, a little hoppy aroma. Medium bitterness, some sweetness, the caramel cuts through. Ends dry, good amount of bitterness. Really nice.

0.65l bottle from BrewDøg, Camden. This is a deep deep dark amber-bronze almost brown thing, lots of floaters and particles floating about in the glass and it has a small and eventually sidesticking bubbly light beige top. On the nose I get a fruity sweetness with malts, something light burned, salty leather and licorice in addition to caramel and something light floral. Smells quite nice. IT has a soft oily to watery mouthfeel with a soft carbonation level. Also on the sweet side in the taste: Sticky sweet malty caramel with dried red fruits mainly. Also a hint of something burned in the taste. Burned brown sugar perhaps? Ends with a good hoppy and really bitter burp. Fruity and comfortably tasty. Not to complicated really, and quite easy drinking also. 10.10.2012

Nice caramel/"Boston Baked Beans" aroma. Sweet, yet hoppy and bready. Dark brick red/brown color with a creamy beige head that leaves ya hanging for more. Smooth caramel and bread flavor with a punch in the face strong bitter hop finish. After taste is bitter but doesnt linger. Some warm malt notes keeps you guessing.
Dark red/brown in colour, small tan head. Malty caramel sweetness with citrus hop flavours. Very nice.

Pours a nice dark red/brown color with a thin white head, has some lacing on the glass. Smell is of roasted malt, caramel and pine hop notes. Taste is a very sweet caramel malt and has a big bittering hop presence.

Good hoppy nose with some lovely fruity and floral notes. Appearance is a light red-burgundy with a tan head. Affrontingly hoppy taste but this is what I live about it, some red malt flavours hiding behind the hops, i get caramel, toffee and flowers, maybe chrysanthemums? Palate is hoppy, but pleasant. Overall a pretty good red ale, definitely not a normal one though.

From 12oz bottle at home. Pours red brown with a small tan head. Nice full body that starts malty and finishes with strong hops. Taste is very nice slightly sweet with a lightly bitter finish. A very nice brew.

Pours amber. Aroma is mild but still present; mild hops with some citrus. Flavor is good, though not strong; slight caramel sweetness with citrusy hops. Balanced, smooth, some malty body that moves into a hop flavor. (10/18/12 Total Wine IPA beer tasting class.)

Draft. Pours amber medium tan head. Aroma of caramel, toast, floral, spruce. Taste is medium bitter, and mild sweet. Medium body, ave carbonation, mild bitter finish with additional malt sweet coming through. Enjoyable ale.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2014 11/10/2012: Poured a clear red-brown colour with a thin off-white bubble head that diminished quickly and left some filmy lacing. Aroma strongly of hops. Taste of hops with moderate bitterness. Light body. Very hops driven from start to finish. Dry finish. 22/01/2014: Poured an opaque garnet red with a 5mm off-white frothy head that diminished quickly and laced well. Carbonation low. Aroma of hops, initially subtle but gaining some strength as beer warmed. Taste up front was subtle sweetness followed by strong hops. High ABV well hidden. Medium body. Long mild to strong bitter finish. initially the hops were a bit over-powering but after a while get used to that and it turns into a nice ale.

Bottle. Pours a dark amber color with tinges of red and a moderate white head. I actually get almost no smell off this, though if I smell long enough I can get some faint hints of sweetness. A little bit of malty bitterness to this, which is interesting. Not bad.

Bottle poured into snifter.  Nice reddish brown in color, thick soapy graham cracker colored head.  Nice aroma of grassy hops, spruce, brown sugar, caramel.  Taste starts out with a little syrupy sweetness flanked by caramel before giving way to some bitter earthy hops and very light fruity notes.  Dry but quick finish.  Solid beer.
Bomber. Malty and sweet in a good way. Lots of pine. Well balanced. Light bitterness and alcohol on the finish.

Bottle (BOE) at home - 01/10/12.
Opaque reddish brown with a thin tan head that soon subsides.
Sweet caramel malts on the nose, good dose of pine and plenty of hopping evident.
Taste follows on from the nose with a sweeter and fruitier flavour than the nose had suggested. Sweet caramel and a little biscuit.
Medium bodied with spritzy carbonation. A little on the thin side however.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; pours dark amber with a red tinge, I was pleasantly surprised with the hop aroma. It tasted of hops which were quite well balance with the strong malt presence.
Amber colour, lots of awesome hoppy goodness on the nose. Quit a rich malty flavour with good bitterness and plenty of hop flavour. This is a good, hoppy amber ale.
From bottle to tulip, deep reddish brown.  Great aroma and perfect malty bitter flavor mix for me.  I really like this one!
Aroma is a nice mixture of caramel and coffee notes - crisp, flavorful taste with a clean finish

Bottle. Pours clear dark amber with a small creamy tan head with decent lacing. Aroma is caramel, pine and citrus. Flavor is much the same, with notes of grass and toffee. Medium sweet, lightly bitter to the finish. Quite tasty.

Pours slightly reddish, cloudy, ice-tea with a bit of a soapy ring.
Scent is pink grapefruit, orange peel, hops.
Taste is piney,caramel/toffee.
Nice bitterness, heavy at first, then settles down well.
Becomes more bready as it goes.
Very nice.

wow! This is just a great beer. Wish I could get it all the time. Hot and sticky hot mess with big caramel maltz. its beautiful orange amber body is strunning with sticky yellow head atop. Big floral and citrus hops On the nose with caramel sweetness. Sweet and resinous flavor with big resin hops on the back k end and a mediumly bittered finish. Well balanced with caramel and hop bomb flvor s taking equal turns. Overall just great beer.
Cask at Blind Tiger, NYC. Amber beer with a very small offwhite head. Berry aroma, chocolate, fruity, vinous, toffee, hay, roasted, berry flavor, roasted, toffee, vinous, chocolate.

Pours a slightly hazy brownish copper with decent head and great lacing. Aroma of piney hops, scotch malts, and slight citrus. Taste follows suit, mostly hops though. I can see why it changed from scotch ale to asa...good stuff.

Pours a dark amber/brown.  The yeast is suspended in  the haze,  and takes a long time to settle.  Smells ok but i just cooked dinner so can't really point out details.  Tastes amazing!  Has a great combo of hops, malt and there or some spices I can't put my finger on, maybe  allspice, nutmeg, etc?

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2012 Draft at Proof. Deep ruby pour with a tan head that laces all the way down. Aroma of sweet caramel malt and tons of grapefruit hops. Sweet malty entry with caramel sweetness ending on a bitter grapefruit note pretty good.
22oz bottle.  Reminiscent of a milder Arrogant Bastard (Stone Brewing Co).  Balanced hops and maltiness.
355ml bottle.  Pours a hazy dark caramel with a large head.  Aroma is piney hops, grapefruit and caramel malt.  Taste has minty caramel and piney hops to start.  Bitter sweet, mango finish.
Described as a bastardised Scottish ale. Has the rich caramel malts of the style but with alot more hops. I think it works well.

This. Eer hits your tongue with a hoppy bite. It has a caramel like after taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a medium sized head of foamy finely sized tan colored bubbles that were long lasting and left behind a strongly carbonated very hazy dark red brown colored body and a good lacing. The mild aroma was vinous and malt hop. The crisp mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish mild vinous hop aftertaste. The thick flavor contained notes of Irish red malt brown malt Cascade hops and malt. Delicious and one I would certainly buy again.
The bloody US brewers with their bloody caramel flavour beers. Enough already. Its like an alcoholic maple syrup pancake. Not a fan.

Bottle, thanx to Ole Anders. Pours clear nutty brown with a big creamy off-white head. Aroma of red ripe fruits and nutty malts. Taste is initially strong bitter, with a solid malty body, fresh and crisp hops towards the end, good beer.
UPDATED: SEP 23, 2013 Aroma is caramel malts, hops and mild sweetness.  The flavor is malts, medium sweetness in the middle and then a lingering bitterness in the finish.
Bottle courtesy of my beer pal Ole Anders. Clear chestnut  Caramel, candy, dried fruits, herbal nose. Fruity malty flavors and a nice toasted bitterness. Full body, light over-carbonated, dry tongue.

[Bottle from Beers of Europe] Chestnut with a moderate beige head.  Lovely big, fresh hoppy piney aroma.  Pine dominates in the mouth too, with lots of toffee and then some pithy grapefruit bitterness in the finish.  In fact, despite the sweet body, the bitterness in the end is possibly just a tad too heavy for the beer.  Nevertheless its pretty tasty - a thoroughly enjoyable beer.

Really nice brew. I liked it. Its grainy full bodied big mouthfeel yet smooth.  Nice red amber translucent color. It has a nice malt bill good solid brew with a nice matching hop bill. Real nice overall palate is saturated to a point but great.

Strong roasted malt and earthy hop aromas coming off a reddish brown body with a light tan head.  Strong pine and spicy hops (jalapeno and black pepper) hit first with an almost resiny quality (even though they arent *that* high), but then this is overtaken by a sweet, caramel and toffee malt flavor (how often does *that* happen?).  This further evolves into a heavier molasses like flavor along with a light tobacco/bacon smokiness thats delicious.  The hops then seem to surge back at the end, ultimately leaving a fairly dry bitterness behind.  There seems to be a lot going on in this beer which I didnt expect from the brewing specs.  Very good, if a bit muddled.

Bottle.  Reddish brown beer with a strong head.  The aroma is well hopped and roasted, and the flavour is quite richly malty, roasted and well hopped.  Overall a nice malty and well hopped beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a 355ml bottle on 16/7/2012. Pours a clear amber with a very slight head. Has a huge malty aroma, with caramel, toffee, molasses and toast all there in spades. This is perhaps the first beer Ive tried which Id describe as both a malt and a hop bomb. You get more sweet caramel and toffee, and burnt white toast, some citrus fruit and berries, followed by a boatload of delicious bittering hops. The carbonation is relatively high. A sensational, unusual ale.
Deep copper, clear, off white head. Caramel and toasted malt aroma and flavor, piney hop aroma. Balanced and easy drinking with a nice lingering resinous bitterness in finish.
Pours copper hue with a thin layer of beige head, it has caramel aroma. The flavor is toffee but with dominating bitterness in the finish.

Dark Mahogany pour. No head, no lace. Strong aroma of hop, citrus and malt. Fresh and light on the palate. Hop, grapefruit, and malt taste. A great drink especially served cold. I am just surprised it didnt the weight or boldness I was expected.
This is the beer that got me into American style ales.  It is a good strong flavorful beer that wont let you down. Give it a try!

Bottle. It pours a dark red color with a nice orange head of foam. The aroma is balanced with big caramel maltiness supported by floral and citrusy hops. The malt definitely takes the forefront. The bitterness from the hops comes out more in the flavor with a rather potent woody, piney flavor hiding behind big notes of caramel and red fruit. The finish is very bitter and lightly spicy with pine and earthiness. Its pretty full bodied and has good carbonation. This is kind of an old school craft brew like arrogant bastard that is a bit out of date, but still a classic.
Nice reddish-brown color.  a light hoppy aroma.  Taste bitter at first and finished smooth.

Dark amber, frothy off whit head, and decent lacing.  Citrus, floral, grassy, and mild sweet malt notes.  Full bodied, great balance, flavors like aroma, but a greater malt presence that helps balance the beer.  Medium bitterness and nice tongue tingler.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Even though this beer has a high IBU I find it to be a nicely balanced beer where the hops and bitterness are masked by the malts.

On tap.  Pours a brownish amber with a small off-white head that has decent retention and leaves a good amount of lacing on the glass.  The aroma is caramel with a light hop presence, and a slight nuttiness.  The initial taste is sweet with some caramel, a light nuttiness, and some mild floral hops.  The finish has a light bitterness and some lingering caramel and nuttiness.  Medium body. Medium carbonation.

From 355 ml bottle, it pours a deep russet red, with brighter highlights and a small but lasting head. Theres some fruit on the nose. The real story here though is the magnificent taste. Rich chewy malts are offset by floral, crisp hop flavours. The alcohol is nicely balanced, and the whole thing is a winner. Great stuff.
Pours a dark reddish-brown, smooth taste, bit of a sweet finish.  Tasted on tap at Brooklyn Waterfront Beer Festival, 6/16/2012.

I could smell no aroma in this brew it may be the glass i had. However this brew a clear deep red with a good head retention. The taste was sweet malty at first then the bitterness takes over and theres a bit of a biscut flavor. It had a medium/full body.

Bottle.  Burgundy with an off white foam.  Aromas are red berries and spices with marzipan and spruce.  Earthy with light toffee and hints of chocolate and rye.  Flavours are toffee with pineapple and grapefruit.  Earthy and spicy with peppery alcohol and herbal notes.  Nicely balanced.
I enjoyed this one very much.  The hops hit you up front as you sip this one.  Beyond that is a bready or earthy taste to this one, with just the slightest sweetness.  Very solid Ale.

Pours a murky amber red with a half finger beige head.  Aroma is more malt then hops with a lot of bread malts, caramel, and toffee, with hops aromas of grapefruit and pine resin more in the background.  Taste is mild grapefruit and piney hops up front with a lot of bready sweet malts, caramel, raisins, and toffee as the backbone.  has a medium-full body with a creamy mouthfeel and a long semi bitter finish.  overall, a pretty good American Strong Ale that almost tastes like a toned down version of Arrogant Bastard.

22 oz.  pours clear amber with nice off white head.  Smell is caramel and light fruitiness.  Taste is sweet caramel, pine/resin hops, some light fruits and fig.  Quite a compacted flavor for a 6% beer.  Nice.
Great aroma, very good appearance, strong taste for a cream dark amber. Great beer that leaves a strong taste after you finish it.

Pours a darker amber with a creamy looking beige head.  Aroma filled with pine, resin, caramel, hops, and raisin.  The hoppy impressions disappear in the taste.  Caramel and raisin mostly noticeable along with the pine.  More of an earthy impression.   Drinking is very smooth and creamy, without much carbonation and a bitter finish.  I enjoyed this one.

Purchased this as I really like their Hop Rod Rye.. pours exatly as described, not quite hoppy enough for my taste but there is a resin there, as well as the bitterness I like to find in a fullsome IPA. Well spotted DrunkernV! there is indeed a peachy/lockets/tunes aroma - I couldnt put my finger on it! I raise a glass to your incisive taste buds! half way through and there is more (very pleasant) toffee/burnt caramel coming through. perfect carbonation. Very nice if a little pricey to become a regular beverage.

Pours a deep ruby with a slight haze that clears as it warms slightly. One finger head that quickly disappears into a thin, persistent film. Some lacing. Aroma is light caramel and toffee with piney hops. The hops stand out at first with a medium caramel taste that fades into a bitterness on the back of the palate with a medium body. Overall a good beer, but interesting for the style

Smells slightly like bourbon, malt sweetness, and a faint bit of piney hops. Pours a deep red/brown color with a off white head. Taste is immediately bitter and then has a smooth toffee sweetness and then finishes slightly bitter and clean. Feels medium bodied and a creamy texture that really coats your mouth.

Bottle conditioned; 1pt 6oz split on the patio with the missus. Cherry red with a fine, patchy cream foam. Peachy sweet aroma with honey and throatsweets. Same taste; throatsweet bittersweetness dominates (honey, Tunes, Lockets, peach Soothers). Peach iced tea. Missus loves it but its not to my taste.

Pours a deep amber, with little head and carbonation settles quickly. The aroma is heavy malts, brown sugar, molasses, some caramel, and maybe some coffee tones. The taste is bitter and creamy with mild hops, malts, caramel, and brown sugar. A little bitter for me personally, but not bad for the style.

Pours dark with a nice two finger head hops are the stand out on this beer heaven with a touch of malt very drinkable beer could drink a couple of these bad boy bear republic go ahead with youre bad self

650ml bottle thanks to Dutchdrebus. Slightly hazy ruby red color, small lightly creamy off-white to beige head that leaves fair lacing. Smell pine, spruce, resin, hops, lightly some caramel. So much pine that it almost becomes sweet. Taste malts, hops, bitter, lightly dark chocolate to moccha, some blackberries as well. Pretty weird combination but combines nicely! Medium body and carbo.

Bottle @ home. Copper to amber, hazy colour with a nice off-white head. Smells hops, barley wine like, caramel, sweet, strong, pine, resin, fruity, raisins. Tastes hoppy, bitter, not as sweet as it smells, chocolate.. Great beer. Great carbo, full body.
Tastes of caramel, molasses, spice, and piney hops come in at the end. This is very good, certainly worth buying again.

Pours a very dark reddish brown color with a decent head.  Big aroma of caramel malt and spicy hops.  Taste is very malty and spicy, very good.  Almost tastes like a barleywine.  Finish is slightly dry and spicy, which remains on the tongue for a long time.  A really good beer.

Pours a deep red, good amount of tan foam that leaves some lacing behind. Aroma is hoppy, strong wiff of alcohol. Taste is very hoppy, then sweet and malty. It actually tastes quite a bit like a barleywine only not as strong. Nice stuff.

Clear red copper, foamy light brown head fades. Caramel malt and piney hop aroma. Strong piney resiny hop taste up front, balanced nicely by sweet caramel malts. Some fruitiness and nuts. Softly carbed, medium - full bodied, medium - heavy hopped. Very dry bitter finish. NFL (Not For Lagerboys)

Bottle. This beer is now one of my favourite red ales. It has the lovely caramel malt sweetness with the added bonus of hop bitterness throughout and on the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaske: Rødbrun let diset øl. Tyk duft af sødlig malt, karamel er meget udtalt, men stadig er der en aggressiv humle. Smagen er karamel og igen udtalt humle. Mundfylden er meget tyk og er egentlig fantastisk på så lave alkoholprocenter. God øl.

Bottle from Bine & Vine, San Diego. No BB date. Pours copper with thin latte head that disappear quick. Medium to big aroma of pine, fresh peeled potatoe, lemons, grassy, haylike hops, slightly flowery and a hint of caramel and read fruits, like caramel apples, pear, plum and dried apricots. 
Medium to dry body, lightly roasted malt with some toffee. Pine and grapefruits apparent, and finally some toast and roast as well as burnt raisins. Very nicely balanced and complex. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
(Bottled) TASTES nice and hoppy with aromatic qualities.fuck you . i have a palate.

From the bottle into a shaker at Jacks Urban Eats.  Dark copper color with tan head.  Aroma is carmel malt with some citrus and spruce hops.  Flavor starts with sweet caramel malt, and then transitions into the hop notes.  Big flavor on this one - the sweet malts start quite strong, but then midway through the hops come in big for the finish.  Medium bodied.  Overall a really good beer.
Pour dark amber with small tan head. some Lacing. Smell floral. Taste is caramel roasted malts, grapefruit, dark honey and hops. Med bodied. Bitter after taste.

1/V/2012 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle from The Bottle Shop (Canterbury) @ home - BB: n/a (2012-456) 
Clear deep red brown beer, small aery bubbly head, light beige, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: some amarillo, just as in the Green Flash Hop Head Red we just had before. Sweet, dried fruits, caramel, canned fruits on syrup, some honey. MF: soft carbon, light to medium body. Taste: fruity start, bit of citrus, resinous, some sweet maltiness with a touch of caramel, very bitter. Aftertaste: grapefruit, very bitter, resin, some slight honey-like sweetness. Pretty impressive stuff.

Not bad, the Scottish Ale threw me off because of the sweetness. Smoother and had a quicker finish than I would have liked.but Bear Republichas my attention and I am excited to try some more of their brews.
Pours a deep red color. Aroma of dark fruits, caramel, yeast and grassy hops. Taste is sweet with caramel malts, and brown sugar, followed by a nice grassy hop bitterness. Medium body.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Reddish-brown pour with a beige head. Raisin, chocolate and dark malt aroma. Nice nose. Licorice, toffee, vanilla and caramel flavour. Nice malty taste. Good malty-hop finish. Nice.

330ml bottle, Beers of Europe. Wow! This is a bit of a cracker. Enormous toffee/caramel aroma even when pouring it. Beautiful deep red colour. On the tongue its woody, with just a trace of roast malt, theres grapefruit and tangy citric orange bitterness on the back of the throat. It has a big warmth that spreads very quickly on the swallow and a very long lasting finish with everything mingling together very harmoniously. A real pleasure to sample another of Bear Republics beers in the UK and every bit as good as Racer 5.

330ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Poured with a large, dense & lasting lacy beige to light tan head on a clear, deep ruddy mid brown body. Bittersweet aromatic piney, lightly resinous & grapefruity hops on the nose supplemented by a rich nutty, malty sweetness. Moderately juicy initially on the palate soon becoming dryer & bitter. Grapefruit, pine & resin again to taste with more sweetness present all the while remaining unobtrusive. Medium body, soft to medium carbonation, quite crisp but plenty of heft despite it. Finished with a lingering, rounded hop-dominated bitterness.
Pours a dark red color with a tan head. The aroma is of crystal malts, hops and spices. Taste is very hoppy for a red, almost could pass as an IPA. Enjoyable none the less.  Medium bodied.

[355ml bottle, The Bottle Shop, Canterbury] Hazy brown with a thin lacing. Citrus and pine on the nose, toffee, sweet plum, and a touch of soapy yeast. Toffee and nuts before the piney hops come rollocking back on the finish. Got a lot of frangipane on the aftertaste - at the same time as Ash picked out Bakewell Tart [07042012]

355ml bottle thanks to Beercast_Rich. Pours toffee colour with a red hue and a slim head. The nose has raisins, prunes and a little toffee! The taste has bakewell tart followed by a drying soapy note from middle to end. The palate is medium bodied with a medium to thick texture. Overall, I like this!

Pours a dark opaque reddish brown with medium head leaving a small lacing, full bodied, soft carbonation. Lots of caramel malts, not particularly bitter, or sweet, just very well balanced and very tasty. Yes, very nice indeed.

Bottle, poured a cloudy, dark reddish brown color, full head.  Heavy malt aroma with caramal, nut, tofee, roast, hops.  Med-light bitter, light sweetness.  Medium body.  Ave to soft carbonation.  This is very malty beer, almost kind of syrupy.  Lots of caramal malt.  Hops come out at the end and as it warms. Complex  Enjoyed.

Bottle from Beers of Europe at home. It pours a deep deep amber brown with a ruby red edge to it and a fluffy tan head which blooms then fades. A big pine resin aroma says Here I Am, Dink Me! with some orange marmalade notes playing in the background. Cheek-suckingly bitter at first, an incredibly smooth cherry caramel coffee (but not roast) flavour sweeps in with a little tangerine, leather and pine then suddenly fades. Then just when you think its all over, back comes the pine bitterness from the back of your throat, engulfing the whole mouth like a hoppy tidal wave. The aftertaste sees that same bitterness gradually fading to let the tropical fruit flavour I was anticipating struggle to the surface. This is a seriously hoppy beer, that has assaulted my palate and left it bowed but not beaten. Astonishingly good and absolutely delicious.
Pours a deep mahogany body with a thin white head. Some malty caramel, but the flavor is dominated by hops. Very long, bitter finish.
Cloudy amber colored ale. Small off white head with great lacing. Nose of citrus and pine hops, malty, caramel nut biscuits. Grapefruit, grapes, spice, caramel, and dark sugars dominated the palate.

Amber brown with a good sized fluffy off-white head to it.  The aroma is even parts earthy, roasted malt and floral/citrus hops. The taste is well balanced, toasted, slightly sweet malts and citrus and pine hops flavors. A dry finish.

A beer with truly no category. You pour it into the glass and it looks like a Belgian strong ale. You take a whiff and it smells like an IPA. Tastes like an American pale ale on the front of the tongue, and a dark scotch ale on the back. Very interesting beer

Pours a lovely burnt toffee colour, aroma is a delightful bouquet of floral American hops and some fudge. Flavour has heavy liquorice running throughout, holding together some caramel, lemon, and pine touches. Generally very balanced, with a thick mouthfeel, with the dark, sticky liquorice keeping things interesting. Very good indeed.

Aroma of pine grapefruit and grain. Deep cherry wood color with tan, lacy head. Lots of floating sedimentation. Decently bitter, contrasted with a collage sweet malt flavors. Sort of a brown IPA, as I cant describe it any better. An enjoyable west coast creation.

Bottle.  Pours reddish-brown with a huge khaki colored head.  The aroma on this is pretty much a hop-bomb.  With my eyes closed, id think this was a 8-9% IPA/DIPA.  Taste is pretty darn bitter with some extra bitterness on the finish.  This is one of the most full flavored beers under 7% ive ever had.  Really good.

From notes.  First reviewed 10/17/2011.  Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a pint glass.

This is much darker than I would normally expect an amber ale to be. The color is a full crimson ruby color with amber edges, with a modest eggshell cap that relents to a collar.

The nose is full of caramel malt first, toasted grains second, and a blend of pine and citrus hops third. 

The strong toasted grain and sweet caramel malt cannot prevent a strong bitterness from entering the flavor up front. Sweet and bitter work together, with the hop flavor becoming more noticeable toward the end. Lots of prickly pine, with some juicy citrus as support. This beer is strong on every front.

The body is definitely on the fuller side for the style, with the carbonation coming in on the lighter side of medium, but it all works. There is a stickiness from the malts and a light resin from the hops. 

Everything I have had from Bear Republic has been well done. It would be difficult to find an amber that I would prefer over this one.

Deep red with a tall cream head. Lacing was outstanding. Aromas of grapefruit and pine were powerful. I tasted carmel, grapefruit and apricots, with bitterness upfront and lasting. Body was medium with moderate carbonation.

22 oz bottle.  Pours a cloudy mahogany.  Aroma of caramel, brown sugar, earth, peat, pine.  Flavor is peat, caramel, raisin, pine.  Finish is slightly dry with more piney hops coming through.  A nice American strong ale.

Bottle. Pours a dark reddish color with a beige head. Aroma is of of grapefruit, pine and resinous hoppy notes, with a caramel and sweet malt backbone. Flavor follows the nose, lots of hops up front with grapefruit, earthy, resin and pine notes, along with sweet and caramel malt, toffee and some darker breadiness. The body is on the lighter side of medium with a dry mouth feel. Overall a pretty good brew, that kind of feels like a lighter Arrogant Bastard.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2013 A big red with generous use of both malt and hops.  Good looking: dark mahogany color, lightly hazy, with a large, fluffy and durable head.  Rich, complex, lightly spicy and fruity, with good balance of hops and caramel malts.  Hits the tongue sweet only to be followed immediately with a balancing load of hop bitterness (and flavor). .

Strong, crisp (hoppy) refreshing. Deep red color. Slight alochol after taste. Would drink again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark malt amber color. Tan robust head. Caramel candy the warmer it gets. Drinking this as I attempt to brew a 4 gallon clone of it. I enjoyed this beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[4176-20111203] Tap. Mild grass hops aroma. Slightly hazy, dark red brown body with a quick foamy off-white head. Bitter resin hops flavour has a grainy sweet malt note throughout. Medium body. Good, pretty drinkable. (7/3/7/4/15) 3.6
(@ Mr. Goodbar, Buffalo, NY)

12 fl. oz. bottle. Pours a clear and very dark amber, verging on black, with a moderate off-white head, which lasts quite well and leaves good lacing. Candied fruit, toffee and floral hops on the nose make for a similar aroma to that of a sweeter bitter or English strong ale. The similarity vanishes upon tasting the beer, however. Initially midl floral hops build up into a crescendo of floral, spice and lime hop flavours. These give way to a sweetly malty body, with fruitcake and toffee notes which linger in a nicely fruity finish. This is a top notch ale, with an excellent balance between sweet and fruity malt and deliciously bitter hops.

Nose is citrusy, floral, caramel. Taste is quite malty, but with a great, well-rounded aromatic hop balance. Bitter hops are a tad too pronounced, the aftertaste isnt as delicious as the taste. Overall, a good beer.
Malt and Alcohol on the aroma. Deep copper with some lasting lacing. palate is mostly alcohol. Maybe the temp was off but was not impressed with this beer.

Pours a very deep red.  Nose is toast, resin, licorice.  Taste is malty but not too sweet it has a pronounced bitterness but the malt balances it out.  There is a hole lot going on in this beer, its a punch to your taste buds.

Pours dark amber with a beige head that lasts and lasts. Caramel malts on the nose with a nice strong fresh hop backround. At first taste you can tell this beer is packed full of flavour and its perfectly balanced. Alot of malt flavour with with heavy hop just mixes perfectly i love it.

355mL bottle.  Pours a wonderful clear burnt copper colour with a thin off-white head.  Aromas of sweet citrus, honey, dried fruit, biscuit dough.  Medium sweetness and bitterness, a bit of toast, biscuit and fruit in the flavour.  Medium body, soft carbonation with a lingering fruity and bitter finish.
Draft at brewery, caramel toffee colored pour, toffee aroma, sweet malt driven. Nice bitterness. One of the best ambers out there

Bottle 12oz from Purvis. Strong and well balanced ale. Aromas of caramel, nuts, resin and liquorice. Taste is sweet and bitter, with long length. Palate velvety, with a medium-to-full body. Brown, with a frothy head.

dark deep deep reddish brown colour with a thick tinged head kept me thinking "Scotch Ale", even more when the roasted nut smell came off the top, with a bit of butterscotch lurking around the edges.  But in the mouth, it was fruitier and livelier than Id expect, and the hops came into play nicely.  Good, complex, ale; fun to drink, plays with expectations and rewards in return.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Dark amber pour with a small beige head. Heavy on the caramel back bone with some rich, ripe fruits in there. Ripe citrus and heavier fruits come through in the taste - citrus, grapefruit followed by currannts and date. Light, but lengthy bitter finish. A good, flavoursome and sessionable brew

One of the few BR beers I have not had on tap. Always fresh and crisp out of the bottle. The floral hops and the caramel malt are balanced beautifully. Prefer ice cold. Finish really sags as it warms up.
Really good beer.  This beer in my opion taste like a Black IPA, strong grain bill with an equally strong hop bill.  But still appropriately named for its deep red hue.

Pours a ruby/brown color. The taste is full flavored, malty and maybe a little bread or toast. Some sweetness that goes with the malt and the finish has a nice amount of refreshing hops. Really good when you want a tasty beer, but not overpowering.

Nice citrus cascade hop crispy aroma. Rich deep brown with a tinge of red, and a light tan head. Sweet tangy taste. Sour middle. Hard to nail this one down as its wonderfully complex. Flavors are crisp and fresh. Very nice brew. Id like to have more of these. Excellent!

Poured from a draft into a pint glass. Color was dark red, kind of brownish. About a finger and a half of head. Light tan lacing on the top. Circular gray film on the sides. 

Immediately smelled citrus hops with lemon notes leading the way. Also a bit of aftershave in there. 

Kind of a liquor whiskey taste up front. Dark bitter malts. Also dark fruits, maybe plum of dark cherry?

Full body. Watery texture. Average carbonation. Smooth finish. 

Not a bad beer overall. It was actually a bit better than I thought it would be. And to think I ordered something different and picked this as a second option
Bottle.  Pours ruby/amber with a medium, off-white head.  Hoppy citrus aroma with hints of caramel, roasted malts and a hint of chocolate.  Similar flavor with added grassy/floral hop notes.

A - pours hazy deep mahogany red/brown, with high big bubbled tan head. 

S - aromas of bready hops up front. Notes of dark fruits and apples. Hints of earthiness and caramel malts. 

M - medium body, with no carb. Average palate, slightly syrupry. Lingering bitter ending. 

T - dried dark fruits and malts on the nose,  grassy earthy hops on the palate, lingering grassy alfalfa bitter ending notes of apples throughout.

O - pretty good and drinkable brew, not to heavy, balanced hops, malts, bitter. 

6
UPDATED: FEB 15, 2012 12 oz bottle pours amber with a white head.  Aroma is nice , matly and a little yeast.  The taste is mush the same with a little sweetness.

12 oz bottle into a pint. Deep rich amber in color. Ok head with some lace. Nose is nearly all grapefruit. Taste is a decent mix of malt and hops. However when warm, the malt vanishes altogether. Nothing to bittter even once warm. This is a well made brew and is worth a try.

Pours a deep amber with a large off white head. Aroma is of woody hops with some caramel and citrus. Above medium bodied, viscous, soft carbonation, it is sweet yet very nicely balanced. The finish is dry and hoppy with a solid bitterness. Tastes of west coast Cascade hoppage.
Not for the faint of heart! Decent aroma, rough taste, even worse after taste.

Deep, dark, ruby-brown with a medium sized resilient creamy beige head. Nice lacing. Aroma of Citrus, caramel, raisin, and bready malt. Taste is sweet and fruity with a nicely balanced, moderately bitter hop presence. Medium bodied. Good stuff.

Dark cider/brown color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, woody hops, caramel, & some citrus; Flavor of slight roasted malt, caramel, spicy hops, and citrus; Finish is bitter; Nicely balanced; Really good brew.
22oz bomber. Clean pour with a nice head. Aroma has heavy citrus and some malt. Taste is about hte same with a nice bitter finish. Really nice overall, another tasty win for Bear Republic!

Pours dark brown with a thin white head. Aroma is some fruit, spicy, and bready. Taste is the same. Really a decent beer overall; but it sort of fell through the cracks with me. There wasnt much here to keep my attention. Maybe I need to give it another go.

arom is very fruity and hoppy with light malt background. Appearance is a very darkened brown with a medium foam top. Taste is very sweet caramel with a great mixture of hops and malts. Finish is smooth wi\th a nice bitter aftertaste. Overall, the malt and hop mixture really works well together with a sweet, crisp taste to it. Another good one from Bear Republic. Id give this a B+ rating.
Bottle to glass. Enjoyable smooth drink. Nice deep color and pleasant aroma.
(bottle)   A full flavored, hop-dominated amber ale.  Well classified as an American Strong Ale.  Grapefruit flavored hops with nice body.  Enjoyable to drink.

Bottle @ Brewdog Glasgow. Hazy copper - light amber colour, off-white head. Nose is light caramel, hoppy , citrus, bit of toasted malts. Flavour is light roasted malts, caramel, citrus. Fairly bitter finish.
Bottle @ BrewDog Glasgow. Fruity hop aroma. Cloudy medium dark brown colour, good head. Fruity hop flavour, sour aftertaste. Quite good.

Bottle at DØE tasting.
Clear redbrown with a beige ehad. Aroma moderate+ malty (caramel, dark fruits, roasted) and hoppy (citrus). Flavor moderate+ sweet, heavy bitter. Medium body. Almost an IPA.

On tap at Barleys. Iwas initally bummed that this showed up on a "hopheads" sampler that I ordered; I couldnt imagine why they poured a red.
Until I lifted the glass to my face. This is outstanding beer! Quite malty, as one would expect a well-done red to be, with subtle hints of peat, but beautifully balanced with an explosion of hops. Wow.  Simply wow. This is incredible. The alcohol (6.8%) is slightly noticeable in the finish, but you have to look for it, because the complexity of the hop bill renders it an afterthought.

There is absolutely, definitely room for this in my fridge - although it might never make it that far...

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2011 Great balance of hops and malt to create a full, complex, unique and very satisfying beer. Lean towards the hop-forward side, very IPA-like, but not harshly bitter, and the complexity of the malt keeps it interesting. A favorite.
Pours rusty brown very little head. Slightly sweet smell low carbonation with a big flavor, grain bitterness and a bit of spice. Nice change of pace.

Video review at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XK2ZiNYHyvo

Appearance: Deep mahogany w/ red transparencies, 2-finger head stays, excellent lacing

Smell: Caramel malts, raisin, hibiscus, ripe cherry, white chalkiness

Taste: Medium body, bittersweet chocolate, white chalk, brown sugar, espresso, sweet carmel malts, raisin, fig, hint of strawberry, burning beach wood smoky residual,balanced hop bitterness, creamy mouthfeel, medium carbonation

Pairings: Burger
Poured from the bottle. Ive been wanting to try this for a while. Reminds me of unita duhbee. The aroma is malty some hops. Flavour also has lots of malt flavor. Overall an OK beer.

Bottled 355ml. -from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Deep mahagony coloured, medium sized off-white head, hoppy fruity nose. Light roasty, fruity and strong hoppy bitterness in the finish and aftertaste. Also notes of grapefruit and hint of caramel. Nice one.

Pour is a deep dark brown with a nice sized off white head. Nose is of hops, dark fruits, and some brown sugar. Taste is holy hops up front with a nice balance of malty flavor in the back end. rather refreshing considering its coloring.

Deep brown pour with a red hue. One-finger cinnamon-khaki-colored head that vanishes 90% of the way pretty quickly - but that 10% lingers for a long time.Lacing is webby and streaky (kind of makes me think of a Hollywood blood splatter). Aroma is sweet, chocolatey and malty. Palate is more hop-driven, though. I think I also get some dark and roasty chocolate. Hop bitterness lingers in the aftertaste. Medium bodied and rich. Delicious despite never really striking a balance between the upfront malts and hoppy backbone. Balance shouldnt be a requirement anyway when you have flavors like this.
Pours hazy dark brown with a small tan head. Quite hoppy and light fruity to roasted malt aroma. Fruity and hoppy flavor. Light roasted malt note to this. Quite bitter and grapefruity finish. Yum

Bottle from Good beer NYC in Manhattan. An amber/red coloured pour with a small off white head. Hoppy, malty aroma. Tastes hoppy, malty, fruity, some caramel, slight bitterness. A decent brew from Bear Republic.

Bottle. Deep amber to brown pour with a somewhat small white ring head. Sediment is noticeable. Very nice aroma of caramel malt, dark fruit, and a touch of booze. Medium palate. Taste is bread, caramel, and a bit of alcohol heat. Very nice brew.

355 ml bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen.
Pours a brown colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of strong hops, sweet dried fruits and nuts. Flavour of sweet toasted malts, nuts, orange, strong hops and pine needles. Medium bodied, rough carbonation and a sweet finish with caramel, orange and bitter hops. A bit homebrewish because of the lack of balance.

650mL bottle poured a deep amber color with about 1 finger of off-white head which left some spots of lacing behind.  Aromas of caramel and some hops.  Taste is moderate hoppy bitterness with some malty sweetness in the background.  A better than average offering which is worthy of a sample or two.

12 oz. bottle from Total Wine in Norfolk, VA.  Pours a murky brown with a foamy off-white head.  Aroma of bold pine and grapefruit hops with an assertive malt backbone.  Really nice bitter hop profile of grapefruit, tangerine, and pine needles and is cut by a nicely balanced caramel malt.  Medium to full bodied.  The alcohol is more present than in most beers at 6.8% ABV.  A wonderful beer.

Big bodied and satisfying, I really liked this one.  It had a strong caramel taste that lasted for quite a while.  It poured a deep brownish red with a low amount of head.  This would make for a relaxing and smooth beer after a long bike ride or an exhausting day outside.

Darker red than expected, rubied hue.  Off white foam.  Aroma is nutty caramels, lots of red apple and candied fruits, some spicy hops.  Taste is much the same, lots of toffee, caramel, candy apples, fruity with a good hop bite.  Note, relatively old bottle (about 2 years) but it is still very enjoyable.

Bottle. Creamy yellow excellent fully lasting head. Amber colour. Heavy malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Vanilla and caramellic notes. Moderate bitter flavor. Long moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate.

Delicious!! This brew poured up a dark mahogany colored body with a thick foamy head with unending retention and lacing. Aromas of caramel, sweet roasted malts, dark fruits (plums, raisins), and a touch of hops. Flavors of caramel, bread dough, and sweet malts with just the right amount of hops to bring the sweats into check. Medium-bodied, moderate carbonation, with a finish that is dry with slight bitter notes and lingering effects. This is definitely a brew that all should try at least once!
Bottle at brewdog. Pours a nice red color. Some hops present, nice malt character. Well balanced. Good all round

From notes: poured red-amber with a small light tan head.  Aroma was of citrusy hops.  Medium-thick body with a mild depth.  Taste was of mild citrusy hops with some nutty malt beneath.  Solid, but I wasnt particularly impressed.
Clear dark reddish brown with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and rather hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 140911

(bottle 10/12/10). Clear dark amber color. Medium off white head. Moderate citrus/grass hop aroma. Same flavor, with moderate spicy hops and light sweet bready malt. Long duration. Moderate bitter finish. Slick texture. Moderate carbonation. Fair lacing.
Pours dark red, fair carb. I taste the bitterness of the hops thru it all, bit malt, somewhat dry to me. Not bad a bit overrated in my books. However I would buy it again

Solid strong ale, tastes like an imperial red or a barleywine, very bitter, hoppy, thick, and fruity.  The abv makes is a little more manageable, so you are not one and done, well balanced, nice from start to finish, very big beer.

Bottle, bought @ Ølbutikken, Cph.
Pours deep mahogany to amber with a fine, frothy, staying, off-white head. Aroma is lovely hoppy, grassy, peach, caramel malts. A hint of chocolate and resin. Medium carbonation, nice dry and creamy palate. Flavour has a very lovely chocolate/caramel malty base with a whole bunch of piney and resiny hops. Very delicious. Long, lingering sharp bitterness. Lovely.

Pours a darker reddish-brown with good-sized head. Nice combination of roasted malt flavors with hop bitterness. When I first tasted it, I was thinking IPA, but this is a pretty complex beer. Nice sweetish finish to it.

Bomber. Nice floral nose of hoppy goodness. Pours cola colored with a thin lingering head. Taste is slight malt with hops.  Nice lingering hops on finish.  Carbonation is perfect (mild). Hops are nicely balanced with each other (there are citrus, floral, and pine flavors). However, I think although the hops are balanced among themselves, there is not enough malt to act as a counterpoint.  Otherwise, a nice beer.

A rich ruby red on the pour with a nice tan lasting head with good lacing. Sweet caramel malt, fruity spices and a nice sweet floral earthy hops fill the nose. Taste is nice sweet caramel malts with nice fruity tones, some yeast and nice hops flavor. Medium body and moderate carbonation on the palate along with a smooth mouth feel. Finish is sweet toasted caramel malt some yeast and fruit spices ending with a nice hops edge to add balance. A brew with malty character and a persistent dry earthy hops bitterness. Overall an interesting but good and drinkable brew.

Botella. Hazy brown colour. Toasty malty bready sweet fruity hoppy aroma. Flavour is sweet with well toasted malt and caramel, some bread, fruity like hoppiness good bitterness. Bottle. Pours hazy brown reddish with a medium off white head.

Poured from a bottle into a snifter. Appearance is a dark amber to brown with a beige to tan head of foam that dissipates relatively quickly. Leaves nice rings of lacing. Aroma is of citra hops and a caramel, malty backbone with a touch of wood. Taste is grapefruit rind up front, giving way to a mellow, earthy finish. This beer kicks some ass. The finish is a smooth melding of everything coming to an apex in a long, dry dissipation.

hazy brown pour with ruby highlights and a thin head.
aroma toffee and orange citrus. 
malty body, caramel/toffee, roasted malt, light chocolate.
Citrusy hop bitterness.

Pours a dark ruby with a slightly off white head.  Aroma is intense citrus hops and caramel malts.  Taste is a blast of caramel, citrus hops with an awesome malt backbone.  Yet another beer I wish was available locally.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2011 good caramel sweet aroma soft fresh water, Im assuming this has been stored poorly with the yeast floaties, taste is still good though.Heavy caramel aroma/herbal hops.Very nice caramel sweet  citrus hop balance  Pretty perfect balance with the malt/hops. Very nice tasting red ale,i notice a lot more pronounced carmel taste  than most other red or ambers, hops take a stand with the heavy caramel taste of this fine red ale.Pretty great beer unfortunatly i think i may have one thats been around a while, as it had a nice layer of dust on the bottle.Besides the suspended dead yeast it was a very nice  red almost chocatly smooth beer. very good.Everybody definatley needs to try this.Otherwise your missing out!
 If you want a good caramel flavor with sweetness and like scottish types or red ales this is a perfect one for that.As far as the many beers ive tried this has a very pronounced carmel taste that is often been said to be in other beers that i find hard to really detect much of a caramel flavor.Definatly carmel in this one.

Above average amber.  Aroma was cascade hops and toffee/caramel.  Taste was slightly more citrus with notes of centennial and what i assumed was simcoe to compliment an aggressively malty amber.  Caramel, bread, and light roast accompany the hops but make it a bit too sweet.

solid amber. Has a strong hop aroma that is balanced by a heavy malt bill. Both are stronger than your average amber but are balanced with each other. Bitterness is mostly in the finish as the malts are heavy and dominant at first. Solid amber but not amazing.

west coast hop bomb, plain and simple. not that thats a bad thing, only that there isnt much imagination involved, but if your a hop head looking for a straight up pucker producing brew, this will get your fix.

Pours rich leather brown. Small fluffy head diminishes very quickly good lacing . Clear with tiny bubbles.  Aroma of toffee caramel, citrus, flowers. First taste of  bitter lemon pith followed by malt and yeast chars toffee, caramel, burnt toast, coffee. Big round earthy oily mouth feel with very long astringent biter finish. Great beer.

Bottle, Long Island, NY - Pours a reddish dark brown with 1 1/2 fingers head with a good amount of lace.  As you bring the beer up for a sip you smell a mixture of citrus fruit an wild flowers. Initially a smooth malty taste followed by a mellow bitter hoppy aftertaste. I like!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle, pours reddish with light brown head.... the aroma is hoppy, bread, berry..... the flavor is bitter, hoppy, berries.....a little bitter finish....

Bottle. Pours hazy brown reddish with a medium off white head. The aroma is citrus, berries, peach, mango and sweet caramel. The flavour is sweet fruit, berries, peach and citrus. Light bready notes. Long fruity finish.
Bottle, pours a dark reddish, the flavour is pretty bitter, some dark fruits in the flavour, it was hard to drink, overall not terribly enjoyable.. wasnt bad but it wasnt amazing ethier
Same bottle as pictured. Poured light red/brown with small head that retained. Full body with nice hoppy aroma and finish.
Tap at Eureka. Rating #1000! Great dark amber/red color with a tan head. Nice hoppy aroma, citrus and subtle caramel sweetness. Flavor is big hops, rich caramel maltiness, real good stuff. (1822)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Bottle (12 oz) from Ölbutikken, Copenhagen, Denmark. Some toffee and bready malt aromas, with clear permufy, piney, and citric hops. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Dry with medium to high bitterness, just a tad metallic. Very tasty.

12oz bottle. Very dark hazy red color, one-finger foamy khaki head. Lots of visible sediment of varying sizes floating around. Some lacing. Roasty, sweet malt, spice aroma. Mildly bitter hops taste coming in second. Dry texture, but nice light crisp carbonation and pleasant aftertaste.
I remember really liking this one. awesome balance between hops and malts. lovely red colour. does Bear Republic have a bad beer?

Super heady and frothy head that is quite thick and lasts a good while.  Poured into a pint on a humid July day in Western Mass.  Genourous malts up front, hops slid in after the first inital burst.  A strong red here, but the brew goes down smoothly.  Cant really realte this to a scottish, so Im loving this one more.  To me seems like a very solid red with plenty of malts.  Color is dark and burnt brown, almost a mild dark chocolate.  May be the best red Ive had in awhile.  The bear makes solid brews.  Wish more were around here.
Wow wow wow! This is so packed with flavor it is unbelievable. Super tasty. Its like a double Scottish red. Sweet hoppy malty grainy delicious.

Dark amber - almost opaque.  Expected a malty tasting brew but instead got a nice shot of bitter hops complemented by a slight sweetness.  Filmy tan head.  Aroma of bitter hops.  A real biting bitterness which is what I really like.  Has some similarities to an IPA.  Nicely carbonated.  Some citrus on the front of the tongue.

Pours a dark amber color with a medium lasting off-white head that eventually goes to an outer ring. Aroma of toasted malt, caramel and hops. Medium body with flavors of roasted malt, resiny hops and citrus. A little darker fruit too. The finish is grassy hops with a lingering fruity aftertaste. Good all around.

12 oz bottle into snifter. Pours a hazy ruby red hue with a medium beige head that falls in a couple of minutes, leaving a ring and some lace. Aroma is grapefruit rind, alcohol, grain. Taste is bittersweet and sour. Has a bready, smoky character. Carbonation is medium, body is full. Not bad.
22oz bottle-pours a tan head and copper color.  Aroma is medum malt, coppery.  Taste is medium malt, coppery/pine hops.
Pretty red amber color and solid mouth feel. Hops and malt sweetness well balanced---but boring! A weak competitor to Stones Arrogant Bastard Ale.
Bottle. Dark amber/brown with small tan head. Flavour is malt, caramel, hops, little bitter, fruit and citrus.

Pour from a 12 oz bottle. Deep red brew with a fine frothy head. Aroma dominated with piney /  citrus hops. Taste is sweet malts with a fine stong hops offset. Palate is rather standard, but good. I was looking for a hopped up red ale and found this - and it is great.
Bottle. Clear ruby body with a small offwhite head. Aroma is caramel, hops, grass, fruit. Flavor is dry, hops, caramel, grass, grapefruit, sweet fruit.. Long bitter aftertaste. Delicious.

12 oz bottle poured into a pint glass. Pours a deep reddish/brown with tan head. Aroma of resinous piney hops, sweet caramel malt, and roasted malt. Taste is lightly sweet and moderately bitter. Mouthfeel is smooth with crisp carbonation.

Pours deep garnet, medium, bone white foamy head. Nose yields caramel maltiness and some resiny hops. Palate is a bit sweet, significant bittering, fairly high carbonation, medium body and slick, somewhat oily mouthfeel. Rich caramel and biscuity malts mingle nicely before giving way to a very assertive bitter finish.  Its a bit too abrasive for me to drink very often, but its still a decent beer every now and again.

Muddy caramel brown in the glass with a quickly fading head and some lacing down the side of the glass.  Aroma is light pine, subtle bitter hops, and a roasted malt/burnt caramel backbone.  Watery feel in the mouth with bitter hops up front with a strong rye/roasted malt taste through the middle, and a bit of an off-tinge sweetness through the finish.  Fair enough beer.

bottle from kihoskh
clear dark brown, large smooth light brown head.
